commit_message:
Refactor app response for api request '/api/keystone/svc-catalog'

Add filtration for service catalog. Now all endpoints that are not
public will not be seen.

Change-Id: I6db214f849d13c4c71e176f00113e889ff2d2997
Closes-Bug: #1798832
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/19/611819/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import copy catalog = copy.deepcopy(request.user.service_catalog) for record in catalog: for endpoint in record[u'endpoints']: if not endpoint[u'interface'] == u'public': record[u'endpoints'].remove(endpoint) return catalog

commit_message:
Add puppet-cinder-tripleo-standalone job

* It overrrides the tripleo-standalone featureset override to run
  cinder specific tempest tests.

* It will help to detect the puppet-cinder tempest specific issues early
  in gates.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/610600/

Change-Id: I5c2073db48192f45b36c4555408fb0cdff72c51d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-cinder refs/changes/34/609934/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
V2 driver is needed to work with ODL 9.0

The new version of ODL (released 28th of August) requires the version 2
of the SFC driver in order for SFC to work

Change-Id: Idc50e27b84cc6287765dea1cb6b69dd53e4960d2
Signed-off-by: Manuel Buil <mbuil@suse.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_neutron refs/changes/86/602086/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: drivers = odl_v2drivers = odl_v2

subject: Create virtualenv without downloading
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-10-23 09:01:11.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-repo_build/commit/52f7a855e11d84a227f8684b799a063ecb4cb38f', 'message': 'Isolate repo wheel builds from pip.conf

The repo wheel builds need to be isolated from pip.conf
to ensure that new wheels can be built whenever doing an
upgrade.

This backport includes the added change to the venv build
options. The venv build process has been removed from Stein
so the added change does not apply.

Change-Id: Iba22f5a11af858b52f006494b30002d34e5aa4f6
(cherry picked from commit ac816e20c33419163dfe78da004011e1eb78605d)
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2018-10-23 09:23:44.000000000', 'files': ['defaults/main.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-repo_build/commit/9d56adf6d1af385a5ea06ff23dcb7b74dcdb4e38', 'message': 'Create virtualenv without downloading

When creating the virtualenv, we would rather just
use the pip/setuptools packages already available on
the host, then upgrade them later. This helps keeps
the builds isolated to the versions we want, and
reduces outgoing requests which is important for
isolated builds.

Change-Id: Iba22f5a11af858b52f006494b30002d34e5aa4f6
'}]
commit_message:
Create virtualenv without downloading

When creating the virtualenv, we would rather just
use the pip/setuptools packages already available on
the host, then upgrade them later. This helps keeps
the builds isolated to the versions we want, and
reduces outgoing requests which is important for
isolated builds.

Change-Id: Iba22f5a11af858b52f006494b30002d34e5aa4f6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-repo_build refs/changes/40/612640/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --isolated --isolated

commit_message:
Remove the redundant attributes

DeleteInstance action inherits from tables.DeleteAction,
the parent class has the 'name', 'classes' and 'icon' attributes,
So remove the unused attributes.

Change-Id: I5ef01ce68edcd7e78ac95747cf5fd8d8f8c96c81

added_lines: from charms.reactive import when, when_not, hookfrom charmhelpers.core import unitdata # Handle Series Upgrade if unitdata.kv().get('charm.vault.series-upgrading'): status_set("blocked", "Ready for do-release-upgrade and reboot. " "Set complete when finished.") return # Series upgrade hooks are a special case and reacting to the hook directly # makes sense as we may not want other charm code to run @hook('pre-series-upgrade') def pre_series_upgrade(): """Handler for pre-series-upgrade. """ unitdata.kv().set('charm.vault.series-upgrading', True) @hook('post-series-upgrade') def post_series_upgrade(): """Handler for post-series-upgrade. """ unitdata.kv().set('charm.vault.series-upgrading', False)

commit_message:
Set container_name as host_var in test inventory

The connection plugin no longer falls back on using the
inventory_hostname as the container_name. Set container_name as a host
var for each container in the test inventory.

In this role's case there are no containers, so I've just removed
the group_var so that the test setup is uniform with other roles
which do use containers.

Change-Id: I5a5063c93eecc7981f6413f37871a97eb0197c85
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ansible-role-systemd_service refs/changes/44/612344/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

added_lines: help=""" The data source used to the populate the host "serial" UUID exposed to guest in the virtual BIOS. Possible sources: * none: a serial number entry is not added to the guest domain xml * os: a UUID serial number is generated from the host "/etc/machine-id" file * hardware: a UUID for the host hardware reported by libvirt. This is typically from the host SMBIOS data, unless it has been overridden in libvirtd.conf * auto (default): uses the "os" source if possible, else "hardware" """),

subject: Fix formatting non-templated cell URLs with no config
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-10-17 14:09:19.000000000', 'files': ['nova/objects/cell_mapping.py', 'nova/tests/unit/objects/test_cell_mapping.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/44e12db8420da9cea8cb23f3b0fabed2d1e0278b', 'message': 'Fix formatting non-templated cell URLs with no config

If transport_url or connection are unset in config, we will fail to format
even non-templated cell mapping URLs due to an overly specific check in the
format routines. This fixes it by always bailing on templating if the config
is unset, and keeping the error message if we were unable to format a
template as a result.

Change-Id: I760580b8e6594be2bee99a5b825a690b07ab9deb
Closes-Bug: #1798158
(cherry picked from commit 133d6b3bcc26bb2e66ef303011280e38add00702)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix formatting non-templated cell URLs with no config

If transport_url or connection are unset in config, we will fail to format
even non-templated cell mapping URLs due to an overly specific check in the
format routines. This fixes it by always bailing on templating if the config
is unset, and keeping the error message if we were unable to format a
template as a result.

Change-Id: I760580b8e6594be2bee99a5b825a690b07ab9deb
Closes-Bug: #1798158
(cherry picked from commit 133d6b3bcc26bb2e66ef303011280e38add00702)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/27/611327/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @mock.patch.object(cell_mapping.CellMapping, '_get_by_uuid_from_db') @mock.patch.object(cell_mapping.CellMapping, '_format_url') def test_non_formatted_url_with_no_base(self, mock_format, mock_get): # Make sure we just pass through the template URL if the base # URLs are not set, i.e. we don't try to format the URL to a template. url = 'foo' self.flags(transport_url=None) self.flags(connection=None, group='database') db_mapping = get_db_mapping(transport_url=url, database_connection=url) mock_get.return_value = db_mapping mapping_obj = objects.CellMapping().get_by_uuid(self.context, db_mapping['uuid']) self.assertEqual(url, mapping_obj.database_connection) self.assertEqual(url, mapping_obj.transport_url) mock_format.assert_not_called()

subject: fix tox python3 overrides
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-09-18 19:15:18.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/05f3dfe5b1213f1d73355d78671b3f976d5e3a35', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I7cbf62cee124db959b1ac2698b6989c3e59a55ab
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I7cbf62cee124db959b1ac2698b6989c3e59a55ab
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/71/603471/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3

commit_message:
Use different base virtual_router_id on openshift

With the default setting, the keepalived that we deploy on the master
node collides with the one that is setup on the undercloud. We simply
need to use a different virtual_router_id_base to prevent
virtual_router_id collision.

Change-Id: I92ef081a111f93ddce4ec42400bcb648b7f7def0
(cherry picked from commit 429bc3ca702c4bb68062a1d9e653d528246d0950)

Deploy cyborg-api via uwsgi

The patch adds the devstack install cyborg-api via uwsgi.

Change-Id: I2dc39affb30505f616a6a275f45b497ba742e64b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cyborg refs/changes/35/612635/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Toggle for deploying Cyborg-API under a wsgi server CYBORG_USE_UWSGI=${CYBORG_USE_UWSGI:-True} CYBORG_UWSGI=$CYBORG_BIN_DIR/cyborg-wsgi-api CYBORG_UWSGI_CONF=$CYBORG_CONF_DIR/cyborg-api-uwsgi.ini if [[ "$CYBORG_USE_UWSGI" == "True" ]]; then CYBORG_API_URL="$CYBORG_SERVICE_PROTOCOL://$CYBORG_SERVICE_HOST/accelerator" else CYBORG_API_URL="$CYBORG_SERVICE_PROTOCOL://$CYBORG_SERVICE_HOST:$CYBORG_SERVICE_PORT" fi if [[ "$CYBORG_USE_UWSGI" == "True" ]]; then remove_uwsgi_config "$CYBORG_UWSGI_CONF" "$CYBORG_UWSGI" fi "$CYBORG_API_URL" \ "$CYBORG_API_URL" \ "$CYBORG_API_URL" if [ "$CYBORG_USE_UWSGI" == "True" ]; then write_uwsgi_config "$CYBORG_UWSGI_CONF" "$CYBORG_UWSGI" "/accelerator" fi if [ "$CYBORG_USE_UWSGI" == "True" ]; then run_process cyborg-api "$CYBORG_BIN_DIR/uwsgi --ini $CYBORG_UWSGI_CONF" else run_process cyborg-api "$CYBORG_BIN_DIR/cyborg-api --config-file $CYBORG_CONF_FILE" fi if [ "$CYBORG_USE_UWSGI" == "True" ]; then disable_apache_site cyborg-api restart_apache_server else stop_process cyborg-api fi

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-10-21 14:43:57.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cyborg/commit/c9398c255ca3b8b5f8ceab111056365d53a71777', 'message': "Don't quote {posargs} in tox.ini

Quotes around {posargs} cause the entire string to be combined into one
arg that gets passed to stestr. This prevents passing multiple args

Change-Id: I1e860339c2fad9e86c0a2cacf344a6ff94325873
"}]
commit_message:
Don't quote {posargs} in tox.ini

Quotes around {posargs} cause the entire string to be combined into one
arg that gets passed to stestr. This prevents passing multiple args
(e.g. '--concurrency=16 some-regex')

Change-Id: I1e860339c2fad9e86c0a2cacf344a6ff94325873
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cyborg refs/changes/75/612175/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: stestr run {posargs}

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-10-19 17:04:30.000000000', 'files': ['cyborg/db/sqlalchemy/api.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cyborg/commit/a58e89365414847ea5b8f2782a923343427faad2', 'message': 'PY3 : Replice dict.iteritems() with dict.items()

Change-Id: Ic23c0c09b346cb59344828e8189036306072e040
'}]
commit_message:
PY3 : Replice dict.iteritems() with dict.items()

py3 tests for cyborg are failing due to
dict.iteritems() which has been removed in python 3 [1].
This patch replaces that usage with dict.items,
which also works in python 2.7, as recommended.

[1] https://wiki.python.org/moin/Python3.0#Built-In_Changes

Change-Id: Ic23c0c09b346cb59344828e8189036306072e040
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cyborg refs/changes/21/611921/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Freezerclient use "token" to authentication is not success

1. When auth_type ='token',loader.load_from_options(**kwargs) is
   not defined these parameters:
   tenent_name, user_domain_id, user_domain_name
2. The class of freezerclient.client.Client add "token" parameter.

Change-Id: I0b320a608677bcac2b6226330f902365a27b58d5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-freezerclient refs/changes/51/612651/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
supported_vnic_type configurable for ovs

Now supported_vnic_types is hardcoded to the mechanism drivers, but that
can depend on several factors, like type of the NIC, admin decision,
etc.
With this patch we put the right to decide which vnic types are
supported for ovs agent into the hands of the admin, by allowing
blacklisting items from the mechanism driver specific list.
Background: http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/neutron_qos/2018/
neutron_qos.2018-07-31-15.00.log.html#l-58

Change-Id: I63e562e2eccc5b02c1c767d6a2c28cb803131e99
Partial-Bug: #1578989
See-Also: https://review.openstack.org/502306 (nova spec)
See-Also: https://review.openstack.org/508149 (neutron spec)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/00/601600/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from neutron_lib.api.definitions import portbindings DEFAULT_VNIC_TYPES = [portbindings.VNIC_NORMAL, portbindings.VNIC_DIRECT]ovs_driver_opts = [ cfg.ListOpt('supported_vnic_types', default=DEFAULT_VNIC_TYPES, help=_("Comma-separated list of vnic types supported by the " "mechanism driver. Please note that the supported " "vnic_types depend on your network interface card, on " "the kernel version of your operating system, and on " "other factors, like ovs version." "In case of ovs mechanism driver the valid values are " "normal and direct." "Note that direct is supported only from kernel 4.8, " "and from ovs 2.8.0. Bind DIRECT (SR-IOV) port allows " "to offload the OVS flows using tc to the SR-IOV NIC." "This allows to support hardware offload via tc and " "that allows us to manage the VF by OpenFlow control " "plane using representor net-device.")), ] cfg.register_opts(ovs_driver_opts, 'OVS_DRIVER')

subject: Prepare migration of base jobs to OSH-infra
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-10-15 11:32:54.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm/commit/000bd2e01fd28f586387fec9417b7725deb0cbaf', 'message': 'Prepare migration of base jobs to OSH-infra

Without this patch, openstack-helm-functional and
openstack-helm-multinode are a repetition of the
openstack-helm-infra-functional and openstack-helm-infra-multinode
jobs.

This is a problem, as multiple patches are required to change a
base job, and can lead to inconsistencies.

Instead the abstract jobs should be defined in only one place,
the openstack-helm-infra repositories. This will therefore be the
location of the openstack-helm project lint, functional, and
multinode "base" jobs.

From that point, openstack-helm-infra and openstack-helm can
implement their own job variants should this be required.

This patch fixes the link dependency between the two repositories
by ensuring all the OSH jobs are using their own local job
definition ("-temp" jobs) during the migration.

commit_message:
Prepare migration of base jobs to OSH-infra

Without this patch, openstack-helm-functional and
openstack-helm-multinode are a repetition of the
openstack-helm-infra-functional and openstack-helm-infra-multinode
jobs.

This is a problem, as multiple patches are required to change a base
job, and can lead to inconsistencies.

Instead the abstract jobs should be defined in only one place, the
openstack-helm-infra repositories. This will therefore be the location
of the openstack-helm project lint, functional, and multinode "base"
jobs.

From that point, openstack-helm-infra and openstack-helm can implement
their own job variants should this be required.

This patch fixes the link dependency between the two repositories by
ensuring all the OSH jobs are using their own local job definition
("-temp" jobs) during the migration.

Change-Id: I3d3193415ba65d58c5dd9bbb1fc515f5399edece
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/610482
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/610488
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/611239

subject: Do not install centralized FIP if HA port is down
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-10-01 17:24:25.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/l3/dvr_edge_ha_router.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/l3/test_dvr_local_router.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/58aaff68cbbe0860f65b64a491ea16380e4d24dd', 'message': "Do not install centralized FIP if HA port is down

The issue scenario happens when we disassociate a floating IP
while the 'master' router host is restarted or powered-off.

When the L3 agent is powered-on again, the HA router state config
still remains 'master', but the ha port is down. And the message
queue still has one 'router_update' message (floating IP
disassociate message), so the L3 agent will sync this router info
at least twice during the restart, one is the router_update, the
other is the L3 agent full-sync.

The first one will add the centralized FIP to the qg-device, because
the router state is 'master'. So for DVR HA routers, only add the
centralized floating IP to the qg-device in the snat-namespace when
the HA port is up. For the restart procedure, if the HA port is up,
but the router is set to 'backup', do not add the floating IP.

Closes-Bug: #1794305
Change-Id: Ib39fe7dcd437a867c69852885c461a594167f6a1
(cherry picked from commit 656a8f872970013ff4c0bc577266cbe7f0343037)
"}]
commit_message:
Do not install centralized FIP if HA port is down

The issue scenario happens when we disassociate a floating IP
while the 'master' router host is restarted or powered-off.

When the L3 agent is powered-on again, the HA router state config
still remains 'master', but the ha port is down. And the message
queue still has one 'router_update' message (floating IP
disassociate message), so the L3 agent will sync this router info
at least twice during the restart, one is the router_update, the
other is the L3 agent full-sync.

The first one will add the centralized FIP to the qg-device, because
the router state is 'master'. So for DVR HA routers, only add the
centralized floating IP to the qg-device in the snat-namespace when
the HA port is up. For the restart procedure, if the HA port is up,
but the router is set to 'backup', do not add the floating IP.

Closes-Bug: #1794305
Change-Id: Ib39fe7dcd437a867c69852885c461a594167f6a1
(cherry picked from commit 656a8f872970013ff4c0bc577266cbe7f0343037)

added_lines: def test_add_centralized_floatingip_dvr_ha( self, super_add_centralized_floatingip): router = l3_test_common.prepare_router_data( num_internal_ports=2, enable_ha=True) router[lib_constants.HA_INTERFACE_KEY]['status'] = 'DOWN' self._set_ri_kwargs(agent, router['id'], router) ri_1 = dvr_edge_ha_rtr.DvrEdgeHaRouter(HOSTNAME, [], **self.ri_kwargs) ri_1.is_router_master = mock.Mock(return_value=True) ri_1._add_vip = mock.Mock() interface_name = ri_1.get_snat_external_device_interface_name( ri_1.get_ex_gw_port()) ri_1.add_centralized_floatingip(fip, fip_cidr) ri_1._add_vip.assert_called_once_with(fip_cidr, interface_name) super_add_centralized_floatingip.assert_not_called() router[lib_constants.HA_INTERFACE_KEY]['status'] = 'ACTIVE' self._set_ri_kwargs(agent, router['id'], router) ri_2 = dvr_edge_ha_rtr.DvrEdgeHaRouter(HOSTNAME, [], **self.ri_kwargs) ri_2.is_router_master = mock.Mock(return_value=True) ri_2._add_vip = mock.Mock() interface_name = ri_2.get_snat_external_device_interface_name( ri_2.get_ex_gw_port()) ri_2.add_centralized_floatingip(fip, fip_cidr) ri_2._add_vip.assert_called_once_with(fip_cidr, interface_name)
deleted_lines: def test_add_centralized_floatingip(self, super_add_centralized_floatingip): router = l3_test_common.prepare_router_data(num_internal_ports=2) ri1 = dvr_edge_ha_rtr.DvrEdgeHaRouter(HOSTNAME, [], **self.ri_kwargs) ri1.is_router_master = mock.Mock(return_value=True) ri1._add_vip = mock.Mock() interface_name = ri1.get_snat_external_device_interface_name( ri1.get_ex_gw_port()) ri1.add_centralized_floatingip(fip, fip_cidr) ri1._add_vip.assert_called_once_with(fip_cidr, interface_name)

Doc: update useful protection plugins for volume

Karbor support snapshot, freezer and glance protection
plugins for volume now. This patch update the doc.

commit_message:
Add framework for watcher-status upgrade check

This commit adds the functionality of watcher-status CLI for performing
upgrade checks as part of the Stein cycle upgrade-checkers goal.
It only includes a sample check which must be replaced by real checks in
future.

Change-Id: Ic3d066af439797d6f705e805334f729b52ce3aac
Story: 2003657
Task: 26164

added_lines: # Copyright (c) 2018 NEC, Corp. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import sys from oslo_upgradecheck import upgradecheck from watcher._i18n import _ from watcher import conf CONF = conf.CONF class Checks(upgradecheck.UpgradeCommands): """Contains upgrade checks Various upgrade checks should be added as separate methods in this class and added to _upgrade_checks tuple. """ def _sample_check(self): """This is sample check added to test the upgrade check framework It needs to be removed after adding any real upgrade check """ return upgradecheck.Result(upgradecheck.Code.SUCCESS, 'Sample detail') _upgrade_checks = ( # Sample check added for now. # Whereas in future real checks must be added here in tuple (_('Sample Check'), _sample_check), ) def main(): return upgradecheck.main( CONF, project='watcher', upgrade_command=Checks()) if __name__ == '__main__': sys.exit(main())

defined.

commit_message:
swap out easily readable strings for constants

We define most all status in fields. So we should
try our best to reuse it to prevent spelling
mistakes.

Bring 'backing-up' and 'error_backing-up' status
from backup/api.py and backup/manager.py into
VolumeStatus of objects/fields.py.

Change-Id: Ibbd812d21c2cf73f228c10bbe062cf3c11d16799

commit_message:
Parallel erase disk devices

Currently we erase the disks one by one, which takes a long
time to finish, this patch adds support to the IPA so that
it can erase disks in parallel if told so.

Story: 1546949
Task: 11548
Co-Authored-By: yuan liang <leetpy2@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Kaifeng Wang <kaifeng.w@gmail.com>

Change-Id: If5cfb6ec000a654d07103c4b378d4c135249e238
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-python-agent refs/changes/23/346723/17 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from multiprocessing.dummy import Pool as ThreadPool thread_pool = ThreadPool(len(block_devices)) for block_device in block_devices: params = {'node': node, 'block_device': block_device} erase_results[block_device.name] = thread_pool.apply_async( dispatch_to_managers, ('erase_block_device', ), params) thread_pool.close() thread_pool.join() for device_name, result in erase_results.items(): erase_results[device_name] = result.get()
deleted_lines: for block_device in block_devices: result = dispatch_to_managers( 'erase_block_device', node=node, block_device=block_device) erase_results[block_device.name] = result

commit_message:
Save store info for future client query

There's no store info listed when calling 'glance image-show' or
'glance -v image-list' currently. This patch is to save the store info
so it can be used in future query such as image-show and image-list.

Change-Id: I6bfdd92d5a76c752e8c761df00c5fa0263ff6a7a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance refs/changes/06/605006/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.extra_properties = {} def test_upload_save_store_info(self): request = unit_test_utils.get_fake_request() image = FakeImage('abcd') image.locations = [{ 'url': 'file:///opt/stack/glance/images/d7835199-66c2', 'status': 'active'}] self.image_repo.result = image self.controller.upload(request, unit_test_utils.UUID2, 'YYYY', 4) self.assertEqual('file', image.extra_properties['store'])

commit_message:
Release Cinder 13.0.1 for stable/rocky

There have been a number of fixes backported to Rocky
since its initial release.  This patch proposes Cinder
13.0.1 to release the numerous bug fixes.

Change-Id: Id3955e5e09c026918b161a4278659a5c2863940d

commit_message:
Fix issue with first release logic

We need to use .get('releases') in order to get a None value back
instead of a KeyError, as is expected by the logic here.

Change-Id: Iaabf8dd309130ab609c26b01475cf5e0ae0a44dc

commit_message:
write_config: force utf8

When the Templates container some special characters like french
accents, we want to make sure we use utf8 encoding when writting the
config.

Closes-Bug: 1798820
Change-Id: Ic28c9eefb9c78bbc6fcc5c3af8b3ed7e14a91492
(cherry picked from commit 2575fbc8158d2511b95d708be3db2b2852ad1574)

commit_message:
Abort Cold Migration

Provide a way to cancel a cold migration
in the state of copying ephemeral disks.

APIImpact
Change-Id: I40c48ebec4dc6b15ca472bee4bf1c661c76bdb09
blueprint abort-cold-migration
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/32/334732/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ==================== Abort Cold Migration ==================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/abort-cold-migration Provide a way to cancel a cold migration in the state copying ephemeral disks. Problem description =================== In cold migrations, copying ephemeral disks is performed, it takes a long time if the size of the disks are large. If starting the VM instance during copying ephemeral disks, it is necessary to wait the cold migration completion. Use Cases --------- Administrators migrate users' stopped VM instances. If users want to start the VM instances during copying ephemeral disks, they have to wait the cold migration completion. It is a problem because users have to wait comletion of administorator's operations. Proposed change =============== Reuse existing API for live-migration aborting, add the aborting cold migration function. (See 'REST API impact' section.) If executing the API, cancel copying ephemeral disks. Then the VM instance is reterned to the source host. Alternatives ------------ None Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- None. The following existing API is reused. * DELETE /servers/{server_id}/migrations/{migration_id} Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- A new python-novaclient command is added. For example: nova migration-abort <server> Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: natsume-takashi Work Items ---------- * Cancel cold migration API operation * Cancelling a cold migration per hypervisor - libvirt - hyper-v - vmware - xen * python-novaclient 'nova migration-abort' Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= The follwoing tests is added. * Nova functional tests Documentation Impact ==================== The following document is updated. * API Refenence References ========== None History ======= .. list-table:: Revisions :header-rows: 1 * - Release Name - Description * - Ocata - Introduced

commit_message:
Fix a LOG.warning which didn't work properly

Found when checking ci logs here:

http://logs.openstack.org/41/587041/3/check/ironic-inspector-tempest-dsvm-discovery/7912a3a/logs/screen-ironic-inspector.txt.gz#_Oct_17_16_44_39_477744

It's supposed to be printing missing arguments when constructing
an http client.

The http client is supposed to be removed ?soon?, so if the fix is
not required, please let me know.

Change-Id: I2bad387afa2ede56da7164a7bc9a5ac461e78d9c
(cherry picked from commit a28ccb9ef8a55f96923ba4a3af12b73a91b2e448)

commit_message:
Fix QuotasNegativeTest to use non dynamic credentials

The tests with enabled force_tenant_isolation option always use dynamic
credentials. Made changes to QuotasNegativeTest to run test in the new
project.

Change-Id: I62ce52fda632eaa27f8145ce0cead0b13ff8587a
Closes-Bug: #1789938

added_lines: from tempest.api.network.admin import base_quotasclass QuotasNegativeTest(base_quotas.BaseQuotasTest): project_id = self.create_project_with_quotas(network=2) n1 = self.networks_client.create_network(tenant_id=project_id) n2 = self.networks_client.create_network(tenant_id=project_id) n3 = self.networks_client.create_network(tenant_id=project_id)
deleted_lines: from tempest.api.network import base from tempest.common import utilsclass QuotasNegativeTest(base.BaseAdminNetworkTest): v2.0 of the API is assumed. It is also assumed that the per-project quota extension API is configured in /etc/neutron/neutron.conf as follows: quota_driver = neutron.db.quota_db.DbQuotaDriver force_tenant_isolation = True @classmethod def skip_checks(cls): super(QuotasNegativeTest, cls).skip_checks() if not utils.is_extension_enabled('quotas', 'network'): msg = "quotas extension not enabled." raise cls.skipException(msg) # Set the network quota to two self.admin_quotas_client.update_quotas(self.networks_client.tenant_id, network=2) self.addCleanup(self.admin_quotas_client.reset_quotas, self.networks_client.tenant_id) n1 = self.networks_client.create_network() n2 = self.networks_client.create_network() n3 = self.networks_client.create_network()

subject: Make port binding attempt after agent is revived
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-10-23 09:01:18.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/agents_db.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/test_plugin.py', 'neutron/tests/fullstack/test_dhcp_agent.py', 'neutron/tests/fullstack/base.py', 'neutron/tests/fullstack/test_ports_rebind.py', 'neutron/objects/ports.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/plugin.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/81fc369b4a873b2ac21e297dbba7b721cf3637b1', 'message': 'Make port binding attempt after agent is revived

In some cases it may happen that port is "binding_failed"
because L2 agent running on destination host was down but
this is "temporary" issue.
It is like that for example in case when using L3 HA and when
master and backup network nodes were e.g. rebooted.
L3 agent might start running before L2 agent on host in such case
and if it's new master node, router ports will have "binding_failed"
state.

When agent sends heartbeat and is getting back to live,
ML2 plugin will try to bind all ports with "binding_failed"
from this host.

Change-Id: I3bedb7c22312884cc28aa78aa0f8fbe418f97090
Closes-Bug: #1794809
(cherry picked from commit f787f12aa3441ecffef55f261c4d87dbb12ca6cf)
'}]
commit_message:
Make port binding attempt after agent is revived

In some cases it may happen that port is "binding_failed"
because L2 agent running on destination host was down but
this is "temporary" issue.
It is like that for example in case when using L3 HA and when
master and backup network nodes were e.g. rebooted.
L3 agent might start running before L2 agent on host in such case
and if it's new master node, router ports will have "binding_failed"
state.

When agent sends heartbeat and is getting back to live,
ML2 plugin will try to bind all ports with "binding_failed"
from this host.

Change-Id: I3bedb7c22312884cc28aa78aa0f8fbe418f97090
Closes-Bug: #1794809
(cherry picked from commit f787f12aa3441ecffef55f261c4d87dbb12ca6cf)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/41/612641/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from neutron_lib.agent import constants as agent_constsfrom neutron.objects import ports as ports_obj # List of agent types for which all binding_failed ports should try to be # rebound when agent revive _rebind_on_revive_agent_types = [const.AGENT_TYPE_OVS] @registry.receives(resources.AGENT, [events.AFTER_UPDATE]) def _retry_binding_revived_agents(self, resource, event, trigger, **kwargs): context = kwargs['context'] host = kwargs['host'] agent = kwargs.get('agent', {}) agent_status = agent.get('agent_status') agent_type = agent.get('agent_type') if (agent_status != agent_consts.AGENT_REVIVED or not agent.get('admin_state_up') or agent_type not in self._rebind_on_revive_agent_types): return ports = ports_obj.Port.get_ports_by_binding_type_and_host( context, portbindings.VIF_TYPE_BINDING_FAILED, host) for port in ports: if not port.binding: LOG.debug('No bindings found for port %(port_id)s ' 'on host %(host)s', {'port_id': port.id, 'host': host}) continue port_dict = self._make_port_dict(port.db_obj) network = self.get_network(context, port.network_id) try: levels = db.get_binding_levels( context, port.id, port.binding.host) # TODO(slaweq): use binding OVO instead of binding.db_obj when # ML2 plugin will switch to use Port Binding OVO everywhere mech_context = driver_context.PortContext( self, context, port_dict, network, port.binding.db_obj, levels) self._bind_port_if_needed(mech_context) except Exception as e: LOG.warning('Attempt to bind port %(port_id)s after agent ' '%(agent_type)s on host %(host)s revived failed. ' 'Error: %(error)s', {'port_id': port.id, 'agent_type': agent_type, 'host': host, 'error': e})

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because of that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I5aea94cce51f71d98135ef94bab7445de59fa3a5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/93/579793/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Dynamically find releases for move-implemented-specs

This adds a shallow directory walk to find the available releases for
moving implemented specs, so we don't have to update the script per
release to add a release choice.

Change-Id: I80ea14f07da9361b26645d997de0fcbe4ba19afc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/28/592628/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Limit instance create max_count (spec)

Add a configurable and discoverable limit for the maximum number
of instances that a user can create in a single request.

APIImpact

Spec for blueprint instance-max-count-limit

Change-Id: Ibbeafea63eb6901261b75324d8bad440611e67e7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/35/510235/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode =============================== Limit instance create max_count =============================== `<https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/instance-max-count-limit>`_ Add a configurable and discoverable limit for the maximum number of instances that a user can create in a single request. Problem description =================== When creating multiple instances in the same request, a user can specify the ``min_count`` and ``max_count`` parameters. The ``max_count`` is limited by two things today: #. The instance quota limit, which defaults to 10. #. The Neutron port quota limit, which defaults to 50. Some deployments increase these quota limits to much higher values, like 100, 1000 or even higher for instances (think NFV MANO use cases where a single project needs to burst a lot of instances at once). When processing a request, the compute API will process it as thus: - If min_count is not specified, it defaults to 1. - If max_count is not specified, it defaults to the min_count. - If the instance quota usage can allow a given request, the quota check passes. - If the max_count requested is greater than the current port quota available, the max_count is automatically adjusted to the remaining port quota. If the port quota availability is less than the requested min_count, a ``403 Forbidden`` error is returned to the user. Assuming a case where several hundred or thousand instances are specified in a single request, quota restrictions aside, this request is sent to the scheduler for processing via an RPC call from the conductor service. That RPC call is subject to the ``rpc_response_timeout`` configuration option which defaults to 60 seconds. Also, that call from conductor to scheduler is decorated with a retry mechanism [1]_ in the case of an RPC timeout. That retry mechanism will retry at most ``[scheduler]/max_attempts`` minus 1, so by default it will retry two times. The original intent [2]_ of the retry mechanism was to deal with retrying the request to another scheduler worker in an HA setup if the primary scheduler stopped. However, it fails to take into account that a single scheduler worker can timeout processing a large enough request, which actually triggers the same request to be sent again to the scheduler, which is already timing out trying to process the original request. This was recreated in a simple devstack patch [3]_ using the FakeDriver virt driver, disabling instance quotas, and creating instances without networking (to bypass the port quota check). What ends up happening is now that the FilterScheduler is creating allocations for each instance in the Placement service, eventually those retried duplicate requests result in ``409 Conflict`` responses from Placement because there can be multiple greenthreads making the same request on the same instance to the same resource provider. In the devstack patch there is only a single compute node resource provider, but in a large production deployment there would be thousands of compute nodes, and each duplicate request being processed could actually result in instance allocations being made against several different compute nodes, thus affecting the accounting of what is actually consuming resources from those nodes. If by chance one of the concurrent requests fails due to a NoValidHost error, all of the instance allocations created in that request will be rolled back and deleted from Placement. This could affect the results of one of the other concurrently running requests. If none of the concurrently running requests fail, then each instance in the request could actually have one or more allocations against different compute nodes. Use Cases --------- As a user, I want to be able to create multiple instances and know what my per-request limit is when doing so. As an operator, I want to be able to limit the number of instances created per-request which affect scheduler performance. Proposed change =============== Define a configurable per-request ``instance-multi-create`` quota limit, similar to ``[quota]/metadata_items`` or ``[quota]/injected_files`` which are only checked per instance create (and rebuild) request. The ``instance-multi-create`` quota limit value would be checked in the API against the requested number of instances and fail with a ``403 Forbidden`` error if what is requested exceeds that limit. We would also expose the new limit in the ``limits``, ``os-quota-sets`` and ``os-quota-class-sets`` APIs so that a user can discover the value when making the server create request. **Microversion** TODO: This is where things break down. Add new fields to the limits and quota APIs would be done in a new microversion, but does that mean we would only honor those configurable limits, set by the operator, when a user is making a request with a high enough microversion to know that limit? Because if so, then anyone making a request on the 2.1 microversion would bypass this check and still potentially stumble into the RPC timeout issue. Or would we honor the configurable limit as a safety precaution for operators regardless of microversion requested, but let it be known that users would have to get the limit value before making requests if they care about the results? Alternatives ------------ - We could simply remove the RPC timeout retry decorator so that conductor will fail if the RPC call to the scheduler times out. However, doing so will make conductor set all of the instances to ERROR state and the ``instance.host`` value will not be set, and when deleting the instance in the API, any allocations which the scheduler did create for the instance will not be cleaned up. .. note:: We should probably consider attempting to delete allocations from Placement when deleting an instance from the API regardless just so we are not leaking allocations. - We could just document that if instance quota is a very high number, it exposes a deployment to supporting multi-create requests with a high number of instances in a single request, which can cause the above described issues and that those deployments will need to consider setting ``rpc_response_timeout`` to a high value. Note that doing that exposes one to other issues, like waiting a long time on a response to a dead service. - We could add a configuration option for operators to limit the maximum number of instances that can be created in a single request. Without somehow exposing this value out of the API, however, would not be interoperable because the user has no reasonable way of knowing what that limit is per cloud deployment. - We could add a configuration option which does not limit the maximum number of instances that can be created per request, but would chunk the maximum number of instances per request *to the scheduler*. This would essentially make the conductor service orchestrate its calls to the scheduler in batches based on some configurable amount. Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- TODO Security impact --------------- This spec is proposing a way to improve security by rate-limiting instance multi-create requests from impacting the scheduler and potentially corrupting the resource provider capacity and instance allocation accounting in the Placement service. Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- The new limit type and microversion would be exposed in python-novaclient limit and quotas CLIs and python API bindings. Performance Impact ------------------ None; this would actually improve overall performance in the system by making invalid requests fail fast in the API rather than trigger detrimental effects on scheduler performance by automatically retrying scheduling requests due to unexpected RPC timeouts. Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: Matt Riedemann (mriedem) <mriedem.os@gmail.com> Other contributors: None Work Items ---------- TODO Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= TODO Documentation Impact ==================== - Updates to the compute API reference for the new limit type. - Updates to the compute security guide. - Updates to the configuration guide for the new configurable limit option. References ========== .. [1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/353db2d19/nova/scheduler/utils.py#L599 .. [2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/142124/ .. [3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/507918/ History ======= .. list-table:: Revisions :header-rows: 1 * - Release Name - Description * - Queens - Introduced

commit_message:
Provide a region to the K8S Fedora Atomic config

Kubernetes should initialize its Global configuration for the OpenStack
provider with the region specified in the Heat stack.
This will allow user to create Magnum Kubernetes clusters in
multiregional OpenStack installation with different public endpoint for
services.

Task: 22576
Story: 2002728
Change-Id: I66820369b889e16445cad7a48cd0f458aae1c41f
(cherry picked from commit a28e5609f991ce32255f7badcad2514ca8e66ab8)

commit_message:
Install python-virtualenv if not available

This role is failing as it's attempting to to pip
install pip in the geneal env, but pip is not available
on some platforms.
This review does the install in a venv.

Change-Id: Ie7b3215b6997b5c6315ac29691a8798e6636004f

added_lines: - name: Install python-pip yum: name: python-pip state: latest become: true

commit_message:
Fix dvr ha router gateway goes wrong host

During L3 agent restart, the dvr ha router gateway port
binding host may change because the multiple ha router
scheduled hosts.

After this patch, we return the 'master' ha binding host
directly during the gateway port create. And do not let
the original 'master' (current is backup) host override
the gateway port binding host.

Closes-Bug: #1793529
Change-Id: Icb2112c7f0bd42c4f4b1cf32d6b83b6d97f85ef7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/84/606384/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _get_gateway_port_host(self, context, router, gw_ports): binding_objs = rb_obj.RouterL3AgentBinding.get_objects( context, router_id=[router['id']]) if not binding_objs: return gw_port_id = router['gw_port_id'] # Collect gw ports only if available if gw_port_id and gw_ports.get(gw_port_id): l3_agent = ag_obj.Agent.get_object(context, id=binding_objs[0].l3_agent_id) return l3_agent.host for router in routers: gw_port_host = self._get_gateway_port_host( context, router, gw_ports) LOG.info("Set router %s gateway port host: %s", router['id'], gw_port_host) router['gw_port_host'] = gw_port_host
deleted_lines: router_ids = [r['id'] for r in routers] binding_objs = rb_obj.RouterL3AgentBinding.get_objects( context, router_id=router_ids) bindings = dict((b.router_id, b) for b in binding_objs) for rtr in routers: gw_port_id = rtr['gw_port_id'] # Collect gw ports only if available if gw_port_id and gw_ports.get(gw_port_id): binding = bindings.get(rtr['id']) if not binding: rtr['gw_port_host'] = None LOG.debug('No snat is bound to router %s', rtr['id']) continue l3_agent = ag_obj.Agent.get_object(context, id=binding.l3_agent_id) rtr['gw_port_host'] = l3_agent.host

commit_message:
Add prometheus-monitoring namespace

When using 'prometheus_monitoring=true' in the label option,
'kube-enable-monitoring.service' in the master node has stuck in
'Wait for Grafana pod and then inject data source'.
It caused the 'prometheus-monitoring' namespace doesn't exist,
so scripts don't create pods about Prometheus and Grafana.

To fix the error, I added codes in 'magnum/drivers/common/templates/
kubernetes/fragments/enable-prometheus-monitoring.sh' to make
'prometheus-monitoring' namespace.

We could put codes in a new file like 'magnum/magnum/drivers/
k8s_coreos_v1/templates/fragments/create-kube-namespace.yaml',
but I think it's ok.

Change-Id: I23395b41919c6f39cfcc2b4480bcd4b040cae031
Task: 26347
Story: 2003697

added_lines: # Write the file for prometheus-monitoring namespace PROMETHEUS_NAMESPACE_FILE=${PROMETHEUS_MON_BASE_DIR}"/prometheus-namespace.json" PROMETHEUS_NAMESPACE_CONTENT='''{ "kind": "Namespace", "apiVersion": "v1", "metadata": { "name": "prometheus-monitoring", "labels": { "name": "prometheus-monitoring" } } } ''' # Add prometheus-monitoring namespace kubectl create -f '''${PROMETHEUS_NAMESPACE_FILE}'''

commit_message:
Use supplied HELM variable for dep up in Makefile

Updates the helm dep up command to use the $(HELM) variable instead of
the locally istalled helm for the host machine. This bring this line of
code in alignment with the other uses of helm in the same Makefile.

Change-Id: I91bfdceedd3bac0ac49daf5b9410c05e0e840168
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm-infra refs/changes/43/612743/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if [ -f $*/requirements.yaml ]; then $(HELM) dep up $*; fi
deleted_lines: if [ -f $*/requirements.yaml ]; then helm dep up $*; fi

commit_message:
cronjob-checkPGs failure fix

Added role and rolebindings to fix permissions.
Added volumes definitions for ceph-bin, ceph-etc
and ceph-client-adminkeyring
serviceaccount and node selectors

Implements: Bug 1797589
Closes-Bug: #1797589
Change-Id: Ib0e77e088c6aa82e441aba72bebc4b258deb88c4

commit_message:
Add ram/cpu/disk allocation ratio to Hypervisor show

Currently, the ``GET /os-hypervisors/detail`` and
``GET /os-hypervisors/{hypervisor_id}`` API does not get
ram_allocation_ratio, cpu_allocation_ratio and
disk_allocation_ratio.
The user sets the allocation ratio by using the
configuration, but they can not see through Nova API.

APIImpact

Spec for blueprint: add-ratio-to-hypervisor-show

Change-Id: Iaa92f61bc21b338aa935ad272c3758ace3f99eb4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/89/582089/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ==================================================== Add ram/cpu/disk allocation ratio to Hypervisor show ==================================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/add-ratio-to-hypervisor-show Currently, the ``GET /os-hypervisors/detail`` and ``GET /os-hypervisors/{hypervisor_id}`` API does not get ram_allocation_ratio, cpu_allocation_ratio and disk_allocation_ratio. The user sets the allocation ratio by using the configuration, but they can not see through Nova API. Problem description =================== Currently, the ``GET /os-hypervisors/detail`` and ``GET /os-hypervisors/{hypervisor_id}`` API responses cpu/ram/disk size information of the host, but does not return ram/cpu/disk allocation ratio. Users can't get ratio information through Nova API. Use Cases --------- * Operators set the ram/cpu/disk allocation ratio by using the configuration, but when they want to examine the allocation ratio of a compute node, they can only view the database, or log in to the compute node, view the nova.conf file. This is unfriendly for operators. Proposed change =============== * Add a new API microversion to the ``GET /os-hypervisors/detail`` and ``GET /os-hypervisors/{hypervisor_id}`` API to add ``ram_allocation_ratio``, ``cpu_allocation_ratio`` and ``disk_allocation_ratio`` attributes in their response. Alternatives ------------ In order to get ram/cpu/disk allocation ratio, operators can query the nova database, or login the compute node to view the nova.conf. This is unfriendly for operators. Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- Add a new API microversion to ``GET /os-hypervisors/detail`` and ``GET /os-hypervisors/{hypervisor_id}`` API to add ram/cpu/disk allocation_ratio attributes in the response. * ``GET /os-hypervisors/detail`` response:: { "hypervisors": [ { "cpu_info": { "arch": "x86_64", "model": "Nehalem", "vendor": "Intel", "features": [ "pge", "clflush" ], "topology": { "cores": 1, "threads": 1, "sockets": 4 } }, "current_workload": 0, "status": "enabled", "state": "up", "disk_available_least": 0, "host_ip": "1.1.1.1", "free_disk_gb": 1028, "free_ram_mb": 7680, "hypervisor_hostname": "host1", "hypervisor_type": "fake", "hypervisor_version": 1000, "id": 2, "local_gb": 1028, "local_gb_used": 0, "memory_mb": 8192, "memory_mb_used": 512, "running_vms": 0, "service": { "host": "host1", "id": 7, "disabled_reason": null }, "vcpus": 2, "vcpus_used": 0, "ram_allocation_ratio": 1.5, "cpu_allocation_ratio": 16.0, "disk_allocation_ratio": 1.0 } ], "hypervisors_links": [ { "href": "http://openstack.example.com/v2.1/6f70656e737461636b20342065766572/hypervisors/detail?limit=1&marker=2", "rel": "next" } ] } * ``GET /os-hypervisors/{hypervisor_id}`` response:: { "hypervisor": { "cpu_info": { "arch": "x86_64", "model": "Nehalem", "vendor": "Intel", "features": [ "pge", "clflush" ], "topology": { "cores": 1, "threads": 1, "sockets": 4 } }, "state": "up", "status": "enabled", "current_workload": 0, "disk_available_least": 0, "host_ip": "1.1.1.1", "free_disk_gb": 1028, "free_ram_mb": 7680, "hypervisor_hostname": "fake-mini", "hypervisor_type": "fake", "hypervisor_version": 1000, "id": 1, "local_gb": 1028, "local_gb_used": 0, "memory_mb": 8192, "memory_mb_used": 512, "running_vms": 0, "service": { "host": "043b3cacf6f34c90a7245151fc8ebcda", "id": 2, "disabled_reason": null }, "vcpus": 2, "vcpus_used": 0, "ram_allocation_ratio": 1.5, "cpu_allocation_ratio": 16.0, "disk_allocation_ratio": 1.0 } } Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- python-novaclient will have to be updated so that it can process ram/cpu/disk allocation ratio attributes. Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Upgrade impact -------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: huanhongda Other contributors: None Work Items ---------- * Add a new API microversion to ``GET /os-hypervisors/detail`` and ``GET /os-hypervisors/{hypervisor_id}`` API to add ``ram_allocation_ratio``, ``cpu_allocation_ratio`` and ``disk_allocation_ratio`` attributes in their response. Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= Would need new functional and unit tests. Documentation Impact ==================== The nova/api-ref/source/os-hypervisors.inc will be modified. References ========== None History ======= .. list-table:: Revisions :header-rows: 1 * - Release Name - Description * - Rocky - Introduced

commit_message:
Fix the missing region name information for Keystone client

When using several regions, Rally's Keystone client does not use
the region endpoint specified in the context. So we added
the region name used in credentials to be able to connect
to the correct region endpoint

Change-Id: I441aee8ffb82963396d40405ea740276edc7dfe5
Co-Authored-By: rcherrueau <Ronan-Alexandre.Cherrueau@inria.fr>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/rally-openstack refs/changes/94/566294/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-12-01 16:22:58.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs/commit/a4d1abc3b0aacd9fa0a311d826c0be3d2db128fc', 'message': 'Add spec for extending Aggregate scheduling capabilties.

Change-Id: I6a58fef5b7d359b2f31d032e9dcff8b0378ff791
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2018-06-22 13:53:30.000000000', 'files': ['specs/rocky/approved/aggregate-scheduling-filters.rst'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs/commit/d20a41fb30dea83e26afe72f8c9287a936f09c4f', 'message': 'Add spec for extending Aggregate scheduling capabilties.

commit_message:
Add spec for extending Aggregate scheduling capabilties.

Change-Id: I6a58fef5b7d359b2f31d032e9dcff8b0378ff791
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/64/524664/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ========================================== Extended Aggregate Scheduling Capablities ========================================== Openstack Nova provides numerous scheduling filters that allow compute hosts to be selected as candidates for scheduling guests based on a number of different metrics and semantics. Nova also provides the ability to define server groups that allow for affinity/anti-affinity of compute host when scheduling creates. This proposal is to extend the capabilites of scheduling across host aggregates. Problem description =================== Nova does not yet provide the ability to create groupings at a higher level than hosts such as groups of hosts and then apply affinity/anti-affinity policies at that level, similar to how Nova does for server groups, or just filter at the aggregate level rather than host. Being able to load-balance across aggregates rather than just hosts would be especially useful for operators who want to partition their hypervisors in order to perform maintenance such as kernel upgrades on one partition at a time and in doing so be able to maintain certain SLAs to their users. Use Cases --------- Lets say we have an Openstack region and we want split our hypervisors into N groups of M servers where a server only belongs to one group. We then want to say that users deploying multi-node HA applications should ensure that each replica is deployed to a separate group and that when a group is down/unavailable another group should automatically be selected and that applications without specific placement requirements will be evenly distributed across available groups. Currently this can be naively achieved by createing a number of AZs, using the AvailabilityZoneFilter and having users select an AZ on each create, with a build error (NoValidHosts) requiring a new AZ to be manually selected and the create re-issues. It would be much cleaner to have a way to do this without having to expose AZs to the user and by having Nova take care of load-balancing or place guests much as it does today with server groups. Proposed change =============== TBD Data model impact ----------------- TBD REST API impact --------------- TBD Security impact --------------- TBD Notifications impact -------------------- TBD Other end user impact --------------------- TBD Performance Impact ------------------ TBD Other deployer impact --------------------- TBD Developer impact ---------------- TBD Upgrade impact -------------- TBD Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- TBD Work Items ---------- TBD Dependencies ============ TBD Testing ======= TBD Documentation Impact ==================== TBD References ========== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/different-availability-zone-filter

commit_message:
scripts: sources-branch-updater: Make regexp for master branch stricter

The regexp does not work properly when the upstream repo has many
branches named 'master' such as ceph-ansible

0fa368a7441528457b7bcb99f8a860d7987b9ba6 refs/heads/guits-update_req_master
79bd06ad28d8a078bd95923b230eb8d5b66095b2 refs/heads/master

which breaks the script when bumping SHAs. As such, lets make it
stricter by simply matching /master$ instead.

Change-Id: I24526a358d7a21821f8c9789ba199863981f8d7b
(cherry picked from commit a9c72408bef1508fe26f515db02e347892ed8618)

commit_message:
Make master node schedulable with taints

--register-with-taints take no effect when --register-schedulable=false
configured. It's better to drop --register-schedulable and
leave --register-with-taints to make master schedulable

add --pod-infra-container-image=CONTAINER_INFRA_PREFIX
for kubelet on master nodes.

Change-Id: Ia2ce59841d823ba02a65224088e5af1a8c9610b1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/magnum refs/changes/27/608627/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: KUBELET_ARGS="--register-node=true --pod-manifest-path=/etc/kubernetes/manifests --cadvisor-port=0 --hostname-override=${HOSTNAME_OVERRIDE}" KUBELET_ARGS="${KUBELET_ARGS} --pod-infra-container-image=${CONTAINER_INFRA_PREFIX:-gcr.io/google_containers/}pause:3.0"

commit_message:
Switch nodepool builders to zk cluster

Switch over the nodepool builders to our newer zk cluster from the old
single node zk cluster. We will stop building images that the launchers
can see before the launchers move, but this lets us preseed the new
cluster with up to date image data.

Once the images are built with records in the new zk cluster we can
switch over the zuul scheduler and the launchers to this newer cluster.

Change-Id: I95ca326095decc03cf279383fa48dbdfc56ed8c8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/41/612441/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add trove-status upgrade check command framework

This adds basic framework for trove-status upgrade
check commands. For now it has only "check_placeholder"
check implemented.
Real checks can be added to this tool in the future.

Change-Id: Idfeab4c06cba6f841c17ab6e255a29e8707bfa55
Story: 2003657
Task: 26162

commit_message:
Correct check for b64 encoding

The previous fix for Bug #1798066 assumed that b64 decoding a
PEM certificate would throw an exception. This is not true as
PEM certs are b64 encoded. This fix explicitly checks for the
'BEGIN CERTIFICATE' string to check if the supplied ssl_ca
value is encoded or not.

Change-Id: I4fbdb0c2f768f2641b8fb3b43a4f94f2748484c0

commit_message:
Adds resize on shared storage without ssh keys

Resizing an instance on KVM currently requires passwordless ssh access
between all compute nodes. This is not necessarily needed for resizing
an instance where the underlying storage is shared. This spec therefore
addresses a solution to avoid having a single ssh key deployed on all
compute nodes which could be a security risk or a company policy issue.

Change-Id: Ifc95c5d1494a44eb42355556051628b2ef36fbcd
Implements: blueprint resize-on-shared-storage-without-ssh-keys
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/27/551927/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode =================================================== VM resize on shared storage should work without ssh =================================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/resize-on-shared-storage-without-ssh-keys Resizing an instance on KVM currently requires passwordless ssh access between all compute nodes. This is not necessarily needed for resizing an instance where the underlying storage is shared. This spec therefore addresses a solution to avoid having a single ssh key deployed on all compute nodes which could be a security risk or a company policy issue. Problem description =================== As of now resizing an instance on KVM is implemented by transferring the image between compute nodes over ssh. In order to be able to send the virtual disk data files over to the new target host it is currently required to have passwordless ssh access setup between all compute nodes. If the underlying storage on the source and target hosts are the same there is no need to copy these files via ssh. In fact ssh in such an environment currently is only required to find out if the storage is shared or not. Use Cases --------- Having a single ssh key deployed across all compute nodes can be a security risk: Let's assume an attacker managed to break out of it's guest and gained elevated permissions on the host system. In such a scenario any compute node in the same region or maybe even in the same availability_zone has to be considered as potentially contaminated. With that in mind companies with a very strict security policy may do not allow deploying a single ssh key against a large set of compute nodes. Such a company therefore would not be able to use the instance resizing feature on it's KVM infrastructure at all. Allowing resizing on shared storage without the need for common ssh keys will enable such companies from using this feature. Proposed change =============== * Each compute node should report where it saves instance disk files. This for example could be the value of the ``instances_path`` config variable. * The resizing routines will be adjusted to use above information from the nova database instead of trying to find it out themselves via ssh. Finding out if source and target host run on the same shared storage could be done by comparing the IP/Hostname of the NFS share that is provided by above variable. * If no IP/Hostname is found in above variable it has to be assumed that local storage from the compute node is being used. In that case the copy of disk image files needs to be done over ssh as it's being done now. Obviously the check if shared storage is in place or not can be avoided at this point. * Create a new scheduler filter that allows to filter hosts based on the same shared storage. * The resize request that is progressed through the scheduler needs to dynamically add above mentioned new filter or this filter needs to be configured as standard filter in such an environment. Alternatives ------------ A possible alternative would be to just add a flag to the resize request that instructs the scheduler and any involved resize method to assume that shared stored is being used. Such an implementation would require less effort and is more equivalent to the way migrations on shared storage are happening. Data model impact ----------------- TBD REST API impact --------------- TBD Security impact --------------- Not having a shared ssh key deployed across compute nodes does generally increase the security of an openstack environment. Therefore this change does only have a positive effect to the security. Notifications impact -------------------- TBD Other end user impact --------------------- Most likely additional arguments or parameters will have to be added to python-novaclient. Details have to be further discussed and depened on the implementation in detail. Performance Impact ------------------ Needs to be tested after having a first implementation. Generally It can be assumed that there is no real performance impact. On one side we will no longer have to ssh into the target node anymore which saves some time but on the other hand there may will be one additional mysql query. Those two changes probably will equalise themselves. Other deployer impact --------------------- TBD Developer impact ---------------- TBD Upgrade impact -------------- TBD Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- TBD Work Items ---------- TBD Dependencies ============ TBD Testing ======= TBD Documentation Impact ==================== The following documentation will have to be adjusted: * https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/admin/configuration/resize.html References ========== TBD History ======= .. list-table:: Revisions :header-rows: 1 * - Release Name - Description * - Rocky - Introduced

commit_message:
Add history behind nullable project_id and user_id

In the original spec review, there was confusion as to where the new
nullability of project_id and user_id came from.  This change adds words
explaining the history.

Change-Id: I2062a2f3709e62b3e601db0eb5e408b67c330c48
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/74/560174/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: * Old microversion: always succeeds, and new consumer record created.Since calls using older microversions may not pass the project_id and user_id in the request, those columns in the consumers table will be changed to allow null values. In that case, the consumer record will contain the consumer ID and the generation, but the project_id and user_id columns will be NULL. .. note:: The history behind this is somewhat murky. Prior to microversion 1.8, the consumer table didn't exist: consumers were (and to some extent, still are) just UUIDs in the allocation table. Microversion 1.8 introduced project_id and user_id, which became the only reason for the consumer table to exist. We could have made those fields nullable and created the database entry anyway when processing allocations at older microversions; but instead we decided to make the fields non-nullable and avoid creating the record (since it would have just contained the consumer UUID and null project_id/user_id). With this spec, we have a reason (the generation) to make sure the consumer record always gets created, even at microversions prior to 1.8. So we're making the project_id and user_id fields nullable so that we can do that.
deleted_lines: * Old microversion: always succeeds, and new consumer record created. Since calls using older microversions may not pass the project_id and user_id in the request, those columns in the consumers table will be changed to allow null values. In that case, the consumer record will contain the consumer ID and the generation, but the project_id and user_id columns will be NULL.

commit_message:
[gate] allow pip caching

The pip cache is useful for repeat operations and doesn't seem to have
any real downsides.

Change-Id: Iadb21a118f8d725911a9baa6a9264b8644012af9

commit_message:
Ceph: A script to check object replication across the hosts

this script will  create  an object and see if the object is
getting replicated across diffrent hosts  or not.

Change-Id: Ic5056c1a07dc5d5b6a5d6fc24e3d9a75fa46458f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm-infra refs/changes/86/610186/17 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/usr/bin/python2 import subprocess import json import sys import collections cmdRep = 'ceph osd map rbd testreplication -f json-pretty' objectRep = subprocess.check_output(cmdRep, shell=True) repOut = json.loads(objectRep) osdNumbers = repOut['up'] print osdNumbers osdHosts= [] for osd in osdNumbers: print osd cmdFind = 'ceph osd find' + ' ' + str(osd) osdFind = subprocess.check_output(cmdFind , shell=True) osdHost = json.loads(osdFind) osdHostLocation = osdHost['crush_location'] osdHosts.append(osdHostLocation['host']) print osdHosts print "host having duplicate objects are:" + str([item for item, count in collections.Counter(osdHosts).items() if count > 1])

commit_message:
[gate] Put nfs-provisioner in it's own namespace (docker-registry)

Use the 'docker-nfs' namespace to back the docker registry.  This
means we can delete the registry namespace without causing IO lockups.

Change-Id: I1706dd96653598dcfbb81904fde8c0bf92294b06

commit_message:
[gate] Put nfs-provisioner in it's own namespace

Having storage (backend) components in their own namespace means we
can delete the namespaces containing the openstack without causing
system hangs which occur when storage is remove whilst in use.

Change-Id: Ie489709b08929f25cf0e626a8541620a06506b8b

commit_message:
MNAIO: Add legacy os-infra_hosts group back

In https://review.openstack.org/611582 we removed
the legacy group as it has been deprecated since
Newton, however it appears to still be used by some
downstream tests, so we add it back, but make it
only get implemented if the associated services
are enabled.

Change-Id: I477a46d606d75d44a1ecd5bcfcb29c8308c65245

commit_message:
Choose default network on ambiguity

Depends-On: I465ea140910af50d62ab281d26357861cf96952b

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/47/520247/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ============================== Choose Neutron Default Network ============================== https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1690439 Choose the default network if a tenant has more than one network visible and there is default network among them. Problem description =================== Today if a tenant has more than a network visible to it and during boot it does not specify any network, the NetworkAmbiguous error is raised. It would be nice if there was a way for dealing with NetworkAmbiguous error. Use Cases --------- * An operator wants to specify a default network for a tenant. This network can be used to resolve ambiguity if there are multiple networks available to the tenant. * An operator wants an option to configure either a shared default network for all tenants or tenant-level default networks for each tenant. * An end user wants to boot an instance without choosing a network and expects Nova to automatically select a network for the instance. Proposed change =============== In Neutron, there is an on-going effort to introduce an attribute 'is_default' to network. This attribute indicates if a network is a default network. If a network is created or updated as default, neutron will ensure the following: * At most one default external network exists globally. * At most one default shared network exists globally. * At most one default network exists per-tenant. This spec proposes to leverage above feature in Neutron to resolve the network ambiguity problem. If a user creates an instance without requesting a specific network, Nova will try to choose a network for the instance. In particular, Nova will retrieve a list of available networks from neutron. The list of available networks is consistent of (i) all shared networks visible to the tenant and (ii) all private networks belongs to the tenant. If there is one network in the list, the network will be chosen. If there are more than one networks in the list, Nova will attempt to choose one from the list. Depending on how Nova was configured, one of the following actions will be taken: * Choose a network that has both 'shared' and 'is_default' set to True if there is one. * Choose a network that has 'is_default' set to True and its 'tenant_id' mataches the ID of current tenant. If above search succeeds, a network will be chosen. Otherwise, Nova will raise an error. Alternatives ------------ None Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- * URL: POST /v2.1/servers In the case that there is no requested network, Nova will return either a 200 response or a 400 response depending on if there is a default network available to the tenant. Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- Users are able to boot an instance without specifying a network if their cloud provider configured a default network. Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- Deployer has an option to configure how to resolve ambiguity if multiple networks available. Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: hongbin Other contributors: None Work Items ---------- * Implement networks selection on nova.network.neutronv2.api module. * Introduce an option to specify selection scenario (global default or tenant default). Dependencies ============ * Add 'is_default' field to 'network' resource in Neutron. See https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1690439 for the related work. Testing ======= Add the following tests. * Unit tests * Functional tests * Tempest tests Documentation Impact ==================== * API Reference References ========== None History ======= .. list-table:: Revisions :header-rows: 1 * - Release Name - Description * - Queens - Introduced

commit_message:
Set container_name as host_var in test inventory

The connection plugin no longer falls back on using the
inventory_hostname as the container_name. Set container_name as a host
var for each container in the test inventory.

In this role's case there are no containers, so I've just removed
the group_var so that the test setup is uniform with other roles
which do use containers.

Change-Id: If491e94c5d66f7e236bd344980b3d63ab22761d5

commit_message:
Prometheus kubelet.rules change

kube_node_status_ready and up metrics are obsolete to check the kubernetes
node condition. When a kubelet is down that means node itself in NotReady
state. With 1.3.1 kube-state-metrics exporter kube_node_status_condition
metric provides the status value of the kubelet (essentially node).
https://github.com/kubernetes/kube-state-metrics/blob/master/Documentation
/node-metrics.md

kube_node_status_condition includes condition=Ready and status as true,
flase and unknown. When a kubelet is stopped the status will be unknown
since the kubelet itself will unable to talk to API. In other cases it
will be false. When the node is registered and available it will be set to
true.

Replaced the kube_node_status_ready with kube_node_status_condition and
changed the 1h to 1m and increased the severity to "critical". Also

commit_message:
Add mount state rescue block

The mount state could be volitile making it so the "restart-or-reload"
option fails to execute. If this happens the task will now be rescued
and the mount state will be attempted using the regular systemd
module.

Change-Id: I86fc03ad7c72fa4cfdfc598f552f936dda653926
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ansible-role-systemd_mount refs/changes/31/612731/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # the name of the mount. If this command fails # the task will be rescued and the regular # systemd module will be attempted before # failing the task run. - name: Mount state block block: - name: Set the state of the mount shell: >- systemctl {{ systemd_mount_states[item.state] }} $(systemd-escape -p --suffix="{{ systemd_mount_suffix }}" "{{ systemd_mount_item }}") args: warn: no when: - item.state is defined tags: - skip_ansible_lint rescue: - name: Set the state of the mount (fallback) systemd: name: "{{ mount_service_name.stdout }}" state: "{{ item.state }}"
deleted_lines: # the name of the mount. - name: Set the state of the mount shell: >- systemctl {{ systemd_mount_states[item.state] }} $(systemd-escape -p --suffix="{{ systemd_mount_suffix }}" "{{ systemd_mount_item }}") args: warn: no when: - item.state is defined tags: - skip_ansible_lint
