commit_message:
Support shared/dedicated vCPUs in one instance

This feature enables instances that have vCPUs that are pinned to specific
pCPUs and vCPUs that are not pinned to specific pCPUs. We introduce
``hw:shared_vcpus`` as an additional option of ``hw:cpu-policy=dedicated``
in the flavor extra spec.

Co-Authored-By: dineshbhor <dinesh.bhor@nttdata.com>
Blueprint: mixed-cpu-policy-instance
Change-Id: I3004d19e26bc949eb84ac50c65f6b0aa8ee1150a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/34/545734/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ============================================================ Support both shared and dedicated vCPUs in the same instance ============================================================ https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/mixed-cpu-policy-instance This feature enables "vCPUs with shared pCPUs backend" and "vCPUs with dedicated pCPUs backend" to co-locate on the same VM instance at the same time by introducing ``hw:dedicated_vcpus`` as an additional option of ``hw:cpu-policy=dedicated`` in the flavor extra spec. Problem description =================== Some deployments may need to co-locate applications with high performance requirements alongside applications with no performance requirements in the same virtual machine. While high performance loads should be pinned to dedicated pCPUs, low performance loads are allowed to float on host pCPUs and to be shared with other processes for better utilization of host CPU resources. Presently, it’s possible to choose the vCPU policies in flavor: * ``hw:cpu_policy=shared`` - Assign shared pCPUs to the guest (default) * ``hw:cpu_policy=dedicated`` - Assign dedicated pCPUs to the guest But there is no convenient way to assign both dedicated and shared pCPUs to one virtual machine. Use Cases --------- As an end-user, I want vCPUs for processing network packets to be pinned to dedicated pCPUs to get maximum performance. As an operator, I want to save compute resources for guest vCPUs which don’t require high performance. Proposed change =============== We introduce a new option ``hw:dedicated_vcpus`` in the flavor extra specs. * ``hw:dedicated_vcpus=1-7`` The ``hw:dedicated_vcpus`` field is only valid when the ``hw:cpu_policy`` is set to ``dedicated``. If the ``hw:dedicated_vcpus`` isn't set then the vCPUs are all dedicated, if it is set then any vCPUs not listed would be treated as shared vCPUs. Example ------- The compute node has 16 CPUs without hyper threading: * NUMA node0 CPU(s): 0-7 * NUMA node1 CPU(s): 8-15 If you set ``nova.conf`` with the following parameters: .. code:: vcpu_pin_set = 1-3, 9-11 vcpu_dedicate_set = 4-7, 12-15 then the host's NUMACell data model would be like this: .. code:: NUMACell(id=0, cpuset=set([1, 2, 3]), memory=1024, cpu_usage=0, memory_usage=0, mempages=[], siblings=[set([4]), set([5]), set([6]), set([7])], pinned_cpus=set([])) NUMACell(id=1, cpuset=set([9, 10, 11]), memory=1024, cpu_usage=0, memory_usage=0, mempages=[], siblings=[set([12]), set([13]), set([14]), set([15])], pinned_cpus=set([])) Let's build a VM with the following flavor: * VCPU=4, MEMORY=512 * hw:cpu_policy=dedicated * hw:dedicated_vcpus=1-3 InstanceNUMACell object that is passed to libvirt driver would be like the following data model: .. code:: InstanceNUMACell(cpuset=set([0, 1, 2, 3]), memory=512, cpu_policy=fields.CPUAllocationPolicy.DEDICATED, cpu_pinning={1: 4, 2: 5, 3: 6}) The result of the VM xml configuration is expected to be like: .. code:: <cputune> <shares>2048</shares> <vcpupin vcpu='0' cpuset='1-3'/> <--- Shared pCPUs <vcpupin vcpu='1' cpuset='4'/> <--- Dedicated pCPUs <vcpupin vcpu='2' cpuset='5'/> <--- Dedicated pCPUs <vcpupin vcpu='3' cpuset='6'/> <--- Dedicated pCPUs </cputune> After the deployment, the NUMACell data model would be changed to: .. code:: NUMACell(id=0, cpuset=set([1, 2, 3]), memory=1024, cpu_usage=1, memory_usage=512, mempages=[], siblings=[set([4]), set([5]), set([6]), set([7])], pinned_cpus=set([4, 5, 6])) NUMACell(id=1, cpuset=set([9, 10, 11]), memory=1024, cpu_usage=0, memory_usage=0, mempages=[], siblings=[set([12]), set([13]), set([14]), set([15])], pinned_cpus=set([])) Note that the resource tracker should only track the usage of the shared vCPUs and shared pCPUs. Alternatives ------------ One alternative for this is to introduce ``hw:cpu_policy=mixed`` with ``hw:shared_vcpus`` and ``hw:dedicated_vcpus``, but we'd like to reduce option parameters as much as possible. Data model impact ----------------- N/A REST API impact --------------- N/A Security impact --------------- N/A Notifications impact -------------------- N/A Other end user impact --------------------- N/A Performance Impact ------------------ N/A Other deployer impact --------------------- N/A Developer impact ---------------- N/A Upgrade impact -------------- N/A Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: Tetsuro Nakamura (Tetsuro Nakamura <tetsuro.nakamura.bc@hco.ntt.co.jp>) Other contributors: Dinesh_Bhor (Dinesh Bhor <dinesh.bhor@nttdata.com>) Work Items ---------- 1. Add configuration options * Add ``hw:dedicated_vcpus`` option to flavor extra specs. 2. Add support for hardware.py * Enable the ``_numa_fit_instance_cell_with_pinning`` to distinguish dedicated vCPUs from shared vCPUs loading ``hw:dedicated_vcpus`` from flavor extra spec and to build ``InstanceNUMACell.cpu_pinning`` configuration for only dedicated vCPUs. 3. Add support for libvert driver * Add a small check to ``_get_guest_numa_config`` if the vCPU is in ``InstanceNUMACell.cpu_pinning`` or not when it builds the pinning configuration, ``LibvirtConfigGuestCPUTuneVCPUPin`` object. Dependencies ============ This spec depends on the spec "Support both shared and dedicated VMs in the same host" [1]_ being proposed in Rocky. Testing ======= Like anything else that utilizes real hardware, this cannot be tested in the upstream CI. Instead, we will need to rely on unit tests, functional tests (with hardware mocked out), and downstream or third-party CIs to provide testing. Documentation Impact ==================== Document needs to be updated to describe changes introducing a new option ``hw:dedicated_vcpus`` for flavor extra specs. References ========== .. [1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/543805/ History ======= .. list-table:: Revisions :header-rows: 1 * - Release Name - Description * - Rocky - Introduced

commit_message:
Install pip packages during requirements build

Install packages from PIP_PACKAGES before wheel build to be able
to limit dependencies specified in "setup_requires" of packages
listed in upper-constraints.txt, that pip has no way to control.
This is intended to work around https://github.com/lxc/pylxd/issues/308
or similar issues.

Change-Id: I36bd4347727b4c7f4beea2cdba6674445fbb4ca4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/loci refs/changes/51/611451/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Install packages from PIP_PACKAGES prior to wheel build to be able to # control package versions specified in setup_requires, that pip has no way # to control. This allows to work around such issues as # https://github.com/lxc/pylxd/issues/308 if [ ! -z "${PIP_PACKAGES}" ]; then pip install -c /upper-constraints.txt ${PIP_PACKAGES} fi

subject: Handle in-tree tempest plugins
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-04-18 18:32:19.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack/commit/0974ff1cd319c0b27b5cf8fbed93d4d825df55c9', 'message': 'Handle in-tree tempest plugins

A recent patch[1] enabled upper-constraints checking for tempest plugins.
This patch causes failures for some scenarios with in-tree tempest plugins
because pip does not allow applying constraints to local paths. The resulting
error is "installation from path or url cannot be constrained to a version".

This patch handles local paths and URLs without checking upper constraints
but maintains the functionality for packages by name.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/560946
[2] http://logs.openstack.org/39/541039/13/check/octavia-v1-dsvm-scenario/ \
    c801e2b/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-04-17_22_09_54_936113

Change-Id: I445e218ff6a7d739e5f144833853726deaaa1a3a
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2018-04-18 20:39:55.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack/commit/76223ee9a52a25009ec6b744e8301dd061306715', 'message': 'Handle in-tree tempest plugins

A recent patch[1] enabled upper-constraints checking for tempest plugins.
This patch causes failures for some scenarios with in-tree tempest plugins
because pip does not allow applying constraints to local paths. The resulting
error is "installation from path or url cannot be constrained to a version".

This patch handles local paths and URLs without checking upper constraints
but maintains the functionality for packages by name.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/560946

commit_message:
Handle in-tree tempest plugins

A recent patch[1] enabled upper-constraints checking for tempest plugins.
This patch causes failures for some scenarios with in-tree tempest plugins
because pip does not allow applying constraints to local paths. The resulting
error is "installation from path or url cannot be constrained to a version".

This patch handles local paths and URLs without checking upper constraints
but maintains the functionality for packages by name.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/560946
[2] http://logs.openstack.org/39/541039/13/check/octavia-v1-dsvm-scenario/ \
    c801e2b/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-04-17_22_09_54_936113

Change-Id: I445e218ff6a7d739e5f144833853726deaaa1a3a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/56/562356/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Some in-tree plugins are referenced by path and may have already # been added to upper constraints. If we are passed a filesystem path # assume or url it is already the correct version. Otherwise you will # get a pip error "installation from path or url cannot be constrained # to a version" LOCAL_PLUGINS="" REMOTE_PLUGINS="" for plugin in $TEMPEST_PLUGINS; do if [[ $plugin == /* ]] || [[ $file =~ ^.+://[^/]+ ]]; then LOCALS="$LOCAL_PLUGINS $plugin" else REMOTES="$REMOTE_PLUGINS $plugin" fi done if [[ $LOCAL_PLUGINS != 0 ]] ; then tox -evenv-tempest -- pip install $LOCAL_PLUGINS fi if [[ $REMOTE_PLUGINS != 0 ]] ; then tox -evenv-tempest -- pip install -c $REQUIREMENTS_DIR/upper-constraints.txt $REMOTE_PLUGINS fi

commit_message:
Set an upper pin for Cython to please gnocchi

Gnocchi depends on pycradox, which currently has an upper limit for
its dependency Cython. As Cython is not present in upper-constraints
there is nothing to stop the repo build from using the new one, and
the gnocchi venv build fails.

Change-Id: Ib85d545a8879b82be8d492809f9764fa0efb78e6
(cherry picked from commit 1fd9fdc6d8bc82422211f68a99f5b153b2446d19)

commit_message:
Make horizon DB management cron task idempotent

Use a seed in the glance cache management cron task's random
filter so that each host's results are idempotent when re-running.
This prevents the constant changing of the crontab whenever the
playbook is run.

Change-Id: I441d5d30e06f24a1149926f9068e7e4838b3a723

expired and soft-deleted trusts older
than the given date.

commit_message:
Fix issues with and enable Python 3 job

Python 3 disallows implicit relative imports.

When skip_tags is provided as a single string, it will need to be cast
to an array to avoid being treated as a list of characters when compared
to task.tags.

Change-Id: Ib8e7b67b9400fb983aecaae95f50bb3ec35d4c26

commit_message:
Add support for subnet assignment when creating servers

When there are multiple subnets on a network, currently it
is impossible to pass a subnet parameter to the API request
and boot an instance on a specific subnet of that network.
This blueprint aims to modify the create server API to accept
``subnet_id`` as an additional parameter of ``networks`` field
and make booting on a specific subnet of a given network possible.

APIImpact
DocImpact

Change-Id: I0d1c521b2974dc57072ae0d972e33ca677d2a462
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/27/518227/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode =========================== Subnet Support When Booting =========================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/subnet-support-when-boot This spec is to add support for subnet assignment when creating servers. Problem description =================== When there are multiple subnets on a network, currently it is impossible to pass a subnet parameter to the API request and boot an instance on a specific subnet of that network. This blueprint aims to modify the create server API to accept ``subnet_id`` as an additional parameter of ``networks`` field and make booting on a specific subnet of a given network possible. Use Cases --------- As long as more than one subnet exist on one network, either an operator or an end user will feel the need for the control of what specific subnet the instance is to be booted on. Although this can be indirectly achieved by adding a ``fixed_ip`` of that subnet to the API request, a more straightforward method is always preferred. The implementation of this blueprint will make ``subnet_id`` a optional parameter of the create server API request, thus users can assign subnets to their instances directly. Proposed change =============== First, a new version of JSON schema will be added to ``base_create``, which accepts ``subnet_id`` as an additional property of ``networks`` when an API request is made. Second, a ``subnet_id`` attribute will be added to the ``NeworkRequest`` model to save subnet information passed by the API request. Third, the new JSON schema is then utilized to validate the API call that has the new corresponding API microversion. Last, in the server controller's create method, the ``subnet_id`` attribute of ``NetworkRequest`` object is passed to neutronclient when creating a port for the instance. The port created will be on the specific subnet indicated by the ``subnet_id`` parameter, thus the instance is booted on the desired subnet. Alternatives ------------ Propesed change is straighforward and ituitive, so no alternative methods are considered. Data model impact ----------------- A ``subnet_id`` attribute will be added to the ``NeworkRequest`` model. REST API impact --------------- The following is the new JSON schema for ``networks`` paramter when creating a server, which accepts ``subnet_id`` assignment. .. code-block:: javascript { 'oneOf': [ {'type': 'array', 'items': { 'type': 'object', 'properties': { 'fixed_ip': parameter_types.ip_address, 'port': { 'oneOf': [{'type': 'string', 'format': 'uuid'}, {'type': 'null'}] }, 'uuid': {'type': 'string', 'format': 'uuid'}, 'subnet_id': {'type': 'string', 'format': 'uuid'}, 'tag': parameter_types.tag, }, 'additionalProperties': False, }, }, {'type': 'string', 'enum': ['none', 'auto']}, ] } The following is an example request to create a server on a specific subnet of a network with optional parameter ``subnet_id``. A new API microversion will be added to support this. .. code-block:: javascript { "server": { "name": "example-server", "imageRef": "a465de63-fced-42e5-952a-57575d823f40", "flavorRef": "3b2ad4f2-b2fd-4e36-9c39-fd96da369392", "networks": [ { "uuid": "7ff32ad7-35f5-4eec-810d-8db23a668e0f", "subnet_id": "2f68b642-8944-4254-9172-6946f6ee7679", } ] } } Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Upgrade impact -------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: chenn2 Work Items ---------- * Add a new JSON schema to support ``subnet_id`` for server create API request. * Save ``subnet_id`` in ``NetworkRequest`` object and pass it to the server create method. * Modify port create request body to save and pass ``subnet_id`` to neutronclient. * Further work: add novaclient support. * Further work: add openstackclient support. Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= Both unit and tempest tests will be added to test subnet assignment functionality when creating servers. Documentation Impact ==================== Information on ``subnet_id`` parameter of ``networks`` object needs to be included in the documentation of the create server API. References ========== None

commit_message:
Make onboot parameter for ifcfg configuration configurable

Currently the onboot parameter is hardcoded to YES, some
configurations need to disable it.

Change-Id: I139e8e9b2c8ff087ff1bf8daa8c902c4c0833d89
Close-Bug: 1705228

commit_message:
In DevStack install Redis client library via pip, not as system package

System package name depends on Python version, while pip library name
is uniform for both py2 and py3.

Change-Id: I7ba7db61d2b07af4b880393bc0463d733f34f8cf

commit_message:
When shortening span-ids, check if they're already short

If you're given an int, there's nothing to do, just return it

Change-Id: I289dab8cfabaecf243fdc16b972695e83c83c3e4
Closes-Bug: 1795664
Signed-off-by: Shoham Peller <shohamp@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Document Stein review priorities

This captures the user-facing themes we aim to deliver this cycle,
which we'll use as a reference throughout the cycle, in addition to
focusing our review with the runways process.

Change-Id: I18cf0367de4b11f8b515d0d1c9800f6fabf54be6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/07/609807/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Last cycle, we used only `review runways`_ to capture priorities at any given time throughout the cycle. We discussed it at the Project Team Gathering (PTG) during the `Rocky retrospective`_ and determined that while runways were overall a good process for focusing our review efforts, they were not sufficient in conveying any overall priorities or themes we were trying to accomplish over the cycle as a team. So, this cycle, we came up with a set of `user-facing themes`_ at the PTG, for the ourselves to refer to throughout the cycle and help us to organize our work and review outside of runways. Themes are not meant to preempt anything in review runways. The user-facing themes for this cycle are: * Compute nodes capable to upgrade and exist with nested resource providers for multiple GPU types * Multi-cell operational enhancements: resilience to "down" or poor-performing cells and cross-cell instance migration * Volume-backed user experience and API hardening: ability to specify volume type during boot-from-volume, detach/attach of root volume, and volume-backed rebuild These are the user-visible features and functionality we aim to deliver and we'll keep tabs on these efforts throughout the cycle to keep them making progress. .. _review runways: https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/nova-runways-stein .. _Rocky retrospective: https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/nova-rocky-retrospective .. _user-facing themes: https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/nova-ptg-stein-priorities
deleted_lines: TODO: fill this in after the PTG

subject: Make new-style single endpoint version discovery actually work for ironic
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-10-23 12:29:20.000000000', 'files': ['keystoneauth1/discover.py', 'keystoneauth1/tests/unit/test_discovery.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/keystoneauth/commit/72288d3b18e66da3e04c35f60ab43c916b92c59a', 'message': 'Make new-style single endpoint version discovery actually work for ironic

For (unclear) historical reasons the root single version endpoint also
contains "id" and "links" fields. This makes the current workaround
for old-style endpoints take priority over the correct algorithm.
This change reorders the code, so that if "version" is present, it
always take priority over the workaround.

The unit tests are updated to be closer to real output from ironic.

Change-Id: I743b954c6c5b2f986c213acb6ec6af7e08c9f5f8
'}]
commit_message:
Make new-style single endpoint version discovery actually work for ironic

For (unclear) historical reasons the root single version endpoint also
contains "id" and "links" fields. This makes the current workaround
for old-style endpoints take priority over the correct algorithm.
This change reorders the code, so that if "version" is present, it
always take priority over the workaround.

The unit tests are updated to be closer to real output from ironic.

Change-Id: I743b954c6c5b2f986c213acb6ec6af7e08c9f5f8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystoneauth refs/changes/80/612680/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Make glance cache management cron task idempotent

Use a seed in the glance cache management cron task's random
filter so that each host's results are idempotent when re-running.
This prevents the constant changing of the crontab whenever the
playbook is run.

Change-Id: Ia14e867347aeadc6c55cef49f9f2ae0e6f86412f

commit_message:
Remove deprecated rabbit params in guestagent

This revemos the deprecated options rabbit_host,
rabbit_hosts and rabbit_port params in the
trove::guestagent class.

Changes the guestagent config file to use the
transport_url instead of the rabbit options. [1]

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/609981/

Change-Id: I2f102eb15fe59459ab1eed2e4cf87ad3c54d5c78

commit_message:
Switch the charm to support py3

Some major changes:
* the charm has been rebased (from a Python perspective) to be rooted in
  the charm directory.  This is a single root.
* Imports have been changed so that the don't add lots of imports to the
  namespace of the module doing the import.
* The code that used to run at module import time has been made lazy
  such that it only has to run if the relevant functions are called.
  This includes restart_on_change parameters, the harden function and
  the parameters to the guard_map.  Appropriate changes will be
  submitted to charm-helpers.
* Several tests had to be re-written as (incorrect) mocking meant that
  text fixtures didn't actually match what the code was doing.  Thus,
  the tests were meaningless.
* This has had a net positive impact on the unit tests wrt to importing
  modules and mocking.

Change-Id: Id07d9d1caaa9b29453a63c2e49ba831071e9457f

commit_message:
Update Ansible to 2.5.10

With the 2.5.10 release of Ansible, the mysql modules no
longer rely on MySQLdb and therefore no longer need the
mysql-python library - it all uses pymysql instead which
is pure python and python3 capable.

Change-Id: Ie05a1bbd4abd62527b373de54bf6673a5aba8e50
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-tests refs/changes/05/612405/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I663739e2be72e32101764cbccc9713f1f9ba303a
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-designate-bind refs/changes/45/606445/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: basepython = python3

commit_message:
Add framework for sahara-status upgrade check

This commit adds the functionality of sahara-status CLI for performing
upgrade checks as part of the Stein cycle upgrade-checkers goal.
It only includes a sample check which must be replaced by real checks in
future.

Change-Id: Idcb8d9eaf689800812cf6087e9c5937058c89ea6
Story: 2003657
Task: 26152
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/sahara refs/changes/10/611810/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ============= Sahara-status ============= ---------------------------------------- CLI interface for sahara status commands ---------------------------------------- Synopsis ======== :: sahara-status <category> <command> [<args>] Description =========== :program:`sahara-status` is a tool that provides routines for checking the status of a Sahara deployment. Options ======= The standard pattern for executing a :program:`sahara-status` command is:: sahara-status <category> <command> [<args>] Run without arguments to see a list of available command categories:: sahara-status Categories are: * ``upgrade`` Detailed descriptions are below: You can also run with a category argument such as ``upgrade`` to see a list of all commands in that category:: sahara-status upgrade These sections describe the available categories and arguments for :program:`sahara-status`. Upgrade ~~~~~~~ .. _sahara-status-checks: ``sahara-status upgrade check`` Performs a release-specific readiness check before restarting services with new code. For example, missing or changed configuration options, incompatible object states, or other conditions that could lead to failures while upgrading. **Return Codes** .. list-table:: :widths: 20 80 :header-rows: 1 * - Return code - Description * - 0 - All upgrade readiness checks passed successfully and there is nothing to do. * - 1 - At least one check encountered an issue and requires further investigation. This is considered a warning but the upgrade may be OK. * - 2 - There was an upgrade status check failure that needs to be investigated. This should be considered something that stops an upgrade. * - 255 - An unexpected error occurred. **History of Checks** **10.0.0 (Stein)** * Sample check to be filled in with checks as they are added in Stein.

another one check "if response body has key".

commit_message:
Build OpenSUSE Leap 15 by default

This includes the building of OpenSUSE Leap 15 in checks/gates.

As the build of each project requires the building of the
requirements first, added to the fact that a new distro is added
into the jobs, this extends the timeout for the base job beyond
the maximum time for requirements, so that all the projects
(excluding requirements) have more time to complete.

Change-Id: I73b055b3942a6d80b8474544a9d65df0b3005e15

added_lines: ARG FROM=opensuse/leap:15 FROM ${FROM} ARG PIP_INDEX_URL=https://pypi.python.org/simple/ ARG PIP_TRUSTED_HOST=pypi.python.org ENV PIP_INDEX_URL=${PIP_INDEX_URL} ENV PIP_TRUSTED_HOST=${PIP_TRUSTED_HOST} # If necessary include any mirror override here RUN sed -i 's/ID="opensuse-leap"/ID="opensuse"/g' /etc/os-release

commit_message:
Fix unit tests after charms.openstack update

A recent commit to charms.openstack (78ce162e) added support for
using Endpoint based interfaces rather than RelationBase based
ones.  Update unit test to work with this change.

Add ``.stestr`` to ``.gitignore``

Change-Id: I5fc52738c1c7e918bd9213ef4714733d4e7dd934

commit_message:
policy: allow read of metadata for secret backend

Update policy for secrets backends to allow the metadata about
the backend to be read by remote clients.

This allows the KV store type to be determined.

Change-Id: Iea5d154401ff34e410f5bf5ab6412fe8f8e260b0

subject: Fix parameters in run-tempest role
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-10-22 13:57:20.000000000', 'files': ['roles/run-tempest/tasks/main.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/0e8d27f2b2cce303f26c14361724bad57a23bdbb', 'message': 'Fix parameters in run-tempest role

Readme of run-tempest job declares variable `tempest_test_regex`
to be a regular expression used to select the tests. But in
order to work this variable needs to be passed to tox with
--regex keyword. Otherwise it is passed as positional parameter
leading to error: "tempest run: error: unrecognized arguments" [1]

The similar issue is with `tempest_test_blacklist`, which is declared
as a blacklist file to skip tests that are not needed, so should be
passed with --blacklist-file parameter.

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/59/609959/2/check/tempest-full-profiler-enabled/3054075/ara-report/result/1e906e1a-aa43-42a0-b5fa-2926916dc294/

Change-Id: I0cd0e7c0cfcbd9942736b6a7cbd0929e3878b2e0
'}]
commit_message:
Fix parameters in run-tempest role

Readme of run-tempest job declares variable `tempest_test_regex`
to be a regular expression used to select the tests. But in
order to work this variable needs to be passed to tox with
--regex keyword. Otherwise it is passed as positional parameter
leading to error: "tempest run: error: unrecognized arguments" [1]

The similar issue is with `tempest_test_blacklist`, which is declared
as a blacklist file to skip tests that are not needed, so should be
passed with --blacklist-file parameter.

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/59/609959/2/check/tempest-full-profiler-enabled/3054075/ara-report/result/1e906e1a-aa43-42a0-b5fa-2926916dc294/

Change-Id: I0cd0e7c0cfcbd9942736b6a7cbd0929e3878b2e0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/96/612396/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: command: tox -e {{tox_envlist}} -- --regex={{tempest_test_regex|quote}} \ --blacklist-file={{blacklist_option|default('')}} \

commit_message:
RedHat: Use monolithic openstack-swift package

It seems that RDO moved to a sinlge monolithic openstack-swift package
so lets use that instead. This fixes the following problem:

No package matching 'openstack-swift-plugin-swift3

Change-Id: I9a0efd15be4fde3a96e9feb72bed55d45262cb8c

commit_message:
A/P HA tests

This patch adds scenario tests for kuryr-controller A/P HA.

Implements: blueprint high-availablity
Change-Id: I1cd88056a6f7b719b8b58128ec8fffbce3e816f3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kuryr-tempest-plugin refs/changes/16/590416/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2018 Red Hat, Inc. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); # you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. # You may obtain a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, # WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and # limitations under the License. import datetime import json import time import uuid from oslo_log import log as logging from tempest import config from tempest.lib.common.utils import test_utils from tempest.lib import decorators from kuryr_tempest_plugin.tests.scenario import base LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) CONF = config.CONF class TestHighAvailabilityScenario(base.BaseKuryrScenarioTest): @classmethod def skip_checks(cls): super(TestHighAvailabilityScenario, cls).skip_checks() if not CONF.kuryr_kubernetes.ap_ha: raise cls.skipException("kuryr-controller A/P HA must be enabled.") if not CONF.kuryr_kubernetes.containerized: raise cls.skipException("kuryr-kubernetes must run in " "containerized mode.") def get_kuryr_leader_annotation(self): # TODO(dulek): Make endpoint name a constant. endpoint = self.get_k8s_resource( self.k8s_client.CoreV1Api().list_namespaced_endpoints, CONF.kuryr_kubernetes.kube_system_namespace, 'kuryr-controller') if endpoint: annotation = endpoint.metadata.annotations[ 'control-plane.alpha.kubernetes.io/leader'] return json.loads(annotation) else: return None def wait_for_deployment_scale(self, desired_replicas, desired_state='Running'): def has_scaled(): pods = self.k8s_client.CoreV1Api().list_namespaced_pod( CONF.kuryr_kubernetes.kube_system_namespace, label_selector='name=kuryr-controller') return (len(pods.items) == desired_replicas and all([pod.status.phase == desired_state for pod in pods.items])) self.assertTrue(test_utils.call_until_true(has_scaled, 120, 5), 'Timed out waiting for deployment to scale') def scale_controller_deployment(self, replicas): self.k8s_client.AppsV1Api().patch_namespaced_deployment( 'kuryr-controller', CONF.kuryr_kubernetes.kube_system_namespace, {'spec': {'replicas': replicas}}) self.wait_for_deployment_scale(replicas) @decorators.skip_because() @decorators.idempotent_id('3f09e7d1-0897-46b1-ba9d-ea4116523025') def test_scale_up_controller(self): # TODO(dulek): Make those names configurable. controller_deployment = self.get_k8s_resource( self.k8s_client.AppsV1Api().list_namespaced_deployment, CONF.kuryr_kubernetes.kube_system_namespace, 'kuryr-controller') self.addCleanup(self.scale_controller_deployment, controller_deployment.spec.replicas) # Scale to just a single replica self.scale_controller_deployment(1) # Create a pod and check connectivity name, pod = self.create_pod() self.addCleanup(self.delete_pod, name, pod) ip = self.get_pod_ip(name) self.assertIsNotNone(ip) self.assertTrue(self.ping_ip_address(ip)) # Get current leader annotation annotation = self.get_kuryr_leader_annotation() self.assertIsNotNone(annotation) transitions = annotation['leaderTransitions'] # Scale the controller up and wait until it starts self.scale_controller_deployment(2) # Check if leader haven't switched annotation = self.get_kuryr_leader_annotation() self.assertEquals(transitions, annotation['leaderTransitions']) # Create another pod and check connectivity name, pod = self.create_pod() self.addCleanup(self.delete_pod, name, pod) ip = self.get_pod_ip(name) self.assertIsNotNone(ip) self.assertTrue(self.ping_ip_address(ip)) @decorators.idempotent_id('afe75fa5-e9ca-4f7d-bc16-8f1dd7884eea') def test_scale_down_controller(self): # TODO(dulek): Make those names configurable. controller_deployment = self.get_k8s_resource( self.k8s_client.AppsV1Api().list_namespaced_deployment, CONF.kuryr_kubernetes.kube_system_namespace, 'kuryr-controller') self.addCleanup(self.scale_controller_deployment, controller_deployment.spec.replicas) # Scale to 2 replicas self.scale_controller_deployment(2) # Create a pod and check connectivity name, pod = self.create_pod() self.addCleanup(self.delete_pod, name, pod) ip = self.get_pod_ip(name) self.assertIsNotNone(ip) self.assertTrue(self.ping_ip_address(ip)) # Scale the controller down and wait until it stops self.scale_controller_deployment(1) # Create another pod and check connectivity name, pod = self.create_pod() self.addCleanup(self.delete_pod, name, pod) ip = self.get_pod_ip(name) self.assertIsNotNone(ip) self.assertTrue(self.ping_ip_address(ip)) @decorators.idempotent_id('3b218c11-c77b-40a8-ba09-5dd5ae0f8ae3') def test_auto_fencing(self): # TODO(dulek): Make those names configurable. controller_deployment = self.get_k8s_resource( self.k8s_client.AppsV1Api().list_namespaced_deployment, CONF.kuryr_kubernetes.kube_system_namespace, 'kuryr-controller') self.addCleanup(self.scale_controller_deployment, controller_deployment.spec.replicas) # Scale to 2 replicas self.scale_controller_deployment(2) # Create a pod and check connectivity name, pod = self.create_pod() self.addCleanup(self.delete_pod, name, pod) ip = self.get_pod_ip(name) self.assertIsNotNone(ip) self.assertTrue(self.ping_ip_address(ip)) # Malform endpoint annotation to simulate failure current = datetime.datetime.utcnow() renew = current + datetime.timedelta(minutes=3) malformed = { "holderIdentity": str(uuid.uuid4()), "leaseDurationSeconds": 180, "acquireTime": current.strftime("%Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%SZ"), "renewTime": renew.strftime("%Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%SZ"), "leaderTransitions": 0, } self.k8s_client.CoreV1Api().patch_namespaced_endpoints( 'kuryr-controller', CONF.kuryr_kubernetes.kube_system_namespace, {'metadata': {'annotations': { 'control-plane.alpha.kubernetes.io/leader': json.dumps(malformed)}}}) # Create another pod and check that it's not getting wired. name, pod = self.create_pod(wait_for_status=False) def pod_status(): # TODO(dulek): Make 'defualt' the default pod_obj = self.get_k8s_resource( self.k8s_client.CoreV1Api().list_namespaced_pod, 'default', name) return pod_obj.status.phase != 'Running' self.addCleanup(self.delete_pod, name, pod) self.assertFalse(test_utils.call_until_true(pod_status, 120, 5)) # Wait 120 seconds more, malformed annotation should get cleared time.sleep(120) # Now pod should have the IP and be pingable ip = self.get_pod_ip(name) self.assertIsNotNone(ip) self.assertFalse(self.ping_ip_address(ip, ping_timeout=120)) self.assertTrue(self.ping_ip_address(ip, ping_timeout=120))

commit_message:
Inherit openstackdocstheme for governance.o.o

All governance subwebsites switched from using an old
oslosphinx-based theme to inheriting from openstackdocstheme
instead. Also switch the election website for consistency.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/611761
Change-Id: I3ec2ff2bc2ec6683919ea6541fd657cdc8723df8

commit_message:
Add mount state rescue block

The mount state could be volitile making it so the "restart-or-reload"
option fails to execute. If this happens the task will now be rescued
and the mount state will be attempted using the regular systemd
module.

Change-Id: I86fc03ad7c72fa4cfdfc598f552f936dda653926
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ansible-role-systemd_mount refs/changes/76/612476/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # the name of the mount. If this command fails # the task will be rescued and the regular # systemd module will be attempted before # failing the task run. - name: Mount state block block: - name: Set the state of the mount shell: >- systemctl {{ systemd_mount_states[item.state] }} $(systemd-escape -p --suffix="{{ systemd_mount_suffix }}" "{{ systemd_mount_item }}") args: warn: no when: - item.state is defined tags: - skip_ansible_lint recovery: - name: Set the state of the mount (fallback) systemd: name: "{{ mount_service_name.stdout }}" state: "{{ item.state }}"
deleted_lines: # the name of the mount. - name: Set the state of the mount shell: >- systemctl {{ systemd_mount_states[item.state] }} $(systemd-escape -p --suffix="{{ systemd_mount_suffix }}" "{{ systemd_mount_item }}") args: warn: no when: - item.state is defined tags: - skip_ansible_lint

commit_message:
Fix ShareGroup sqlalchemy model ShareGroupTypes relation.

Fixes manila manage db purge.

subject: fix tox python3 overrides
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-07-03 04:56:16.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/glance-specs/commit/79b27e6502c7ff41af30662cf740275b9a52812e', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I225b740cd85207e2785ab60ba7e626a773617b0c
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I225b740cd85207e2785ab60ba7e626a773617b0c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance-specs refs/changes/64/579764/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: basepython = python3basepython = python3

commit_message:
Use assertRegex instead of assertRegexpMatches

In Python3, assertRegexpMatches & assertNotRegexpMatches
are deprecated in favor of assertRegex and assertNotRegex.

Change-Id: Ifd7cb0d548431095294ad40c99703604f0022888
Closes-Bug: #1798594

commit_message:
Update Ansible to 2.5.10

With the 2.5.10 release of Ansible, the mysql modules no
longer rely on MySQLdb and therefore no longer need the
mysql-python library - it all uses pymysql instead which
is pure python and python3 capable.

Change-Id: Ic8a4ab15663b034b2daa82ce274c31194357e745

commit_message:
Configure Satellite using Ansible instead of a script

- remove rhsm_repository module since it is included with Ansible 2.5
- improve test environment
- convert katello-rhsm-consumer script to Ansible tasks
- gather service and package facts
- use ansible_facts dictionary for facts rather than ansible_[fact]
- set rhsm_server_prefix, rhsm_repo_ca_cert, and rhsm_full_refresh_on_yum
  based on portal or satellite registration

Change-Id: Ifdbcc3b23d5f6ea68dcf904e40a7f44c4b61622e

commit_message:
Implements image certificate verification

This patch implements the feature of support
image certificate verfication when creating
volume from image.

This is a follow up propose from signature verification [1],
also same as Nova certification validation feature [2].

Partial-Implements: bp certificate-validate

[1]: 1faf87284cf674c52a50a9feff6086c05014185c
[2]: 9f0a8999af83bff14acfb0e1adfbcbdbdc2233e6

Change-Id: Iee5b4c825f61d10e39bd953d90fa62cc22430d6f

commit_message:
Use known_hosts module for tripleo-ssh-known-hosts role

- Remove empty files
- Update README

commit_message:
Fixup the docs building

This commit enable users to run `tox -e docs` to build docs for os-ken.
It fixes several issues to ensure the build will succeed.
In addition, the docs from upstream Ryu library is grouped into
archived content. The future work is merging those docs into
the os-ken contents.

Change-Id: I5ee1998e0d2835495650cda530eb0b73c49b091a

commit_message:
Fixes related to installation on Trusty

As the role based macro links are pointing to unreachable destination
and are not required, they will be removed.
Additionally the timesouts are increased for API commands to ES, along
with minor changes around the upstart system manager

Change-Id: I2572bce230af2fd43261c9b0bf903bfd9655959e

Allow creating port by specific subnet_id only

Subnet id is enough for user to create port, neutron
can simple query the db to get the ralated network
id.

commit_message:
Schedule VM's on default host aggregate

The aim of this blueprint is to add a new
`AggregateDefaultHostGroupFilter` scheduler filter.

An operator can define a 'default host aggregate' which has
specific metadata defined. When a VM is booted from an image
which doesn't have special property(e.g. img.os:windows) then
it shall schedule on 'default host aggregate' group.
The new `AggregateDefaultHostGroupFilter` scheduler filter
will help to achieve this.

Change-Id: I87cc7e94043b2e0afa10450861fcec053d40ab93
Implements: bp use-default-host-aggregate-for-vms-booted-using-image-with-no-special-property
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/90/512990/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode =============================================================================== Use default host aggregate for VM's booted using image with no special property =============================================================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/use-default-host-aggregate-for-vms-booted-using-image-with-no-special-property The aim of this blueprint is to add a new `AggregateDefaultHostGroupFilter` scheduler filter. An operator can define a 'default host aggregate' which has specific metadata defined. When a VM instance is booted from an image which doesn't have special property(e.g. img.os:windows) then it shall schedule on 'default host aggregate' group. Problem description =================== Currently there is a filter `AggregateImagePropertiesIsolation` having the possibility to define images that will be scheduled on a specific aggregate following this matrix: +---------------+------------+------------+---------------+------------+ | props \\ aggr | k1=v1 | k1=v2 | k1=v1,k2=v2 | <empty> | +===============+============+============+===============+============+ | k1=v1 | True | False | True | True | +---------------+------------+------------+---------------+------------+ | k1=v2 | False | True | False | True | +---------------+------------+------------+---------------+------------+ | k1=v1,k2=v2 | False | False | True | True | +---------------+------------+------------+---------------+------------+ | <empty> | True | True | True | True | +---------------+------------+------------+---------------+------------+ *Table 1: rows are image properties, columns are aggregate metadata.* The problem is: * An image without key can still be scheduled in a tagged aggregate. For example a host aggregate is defined with metadata img.os:rhel and image has no special property(e.g. img.os:windows) defined. In this case, it's a problem because `AggregateImagePropertiesIsolation` filter will not find the key 'img.os' and the filter returns True thus allowing to boot the instance on the host. Use Cases --------- An operator can define a 'default host aggregate' having specific configuration. When a VM instance is booted from an image which doesn't has special property(e.g. img.os:windows) then it shall schedule on 'default host aggregate'. For licensing problem, operator adds special image property to classify images as below: img.os=windows img.os=rhel img.os=other For example: image 1 property: {} (added by normal user) Host aggregate 1 metadata: {"img.os": "windows"} Host aggregate 2 metadata: {"img.os": "rhel"} Host aggregate 3 metadata: {"img.os": "others"} Host aggregate 4 metadata: {"default_metadata": "images_with_no_special_properties"} When image 1 is used, it should be launched in "Host aggregate 4" which is 'default host aggregate'. Note: In glance, you can restrict an user from adding any specified metadata properties to an image using protection property policy. In the above case, only operator can add image metadata {"img.os": "windows"}, {"img.os": "rhel"} and {"img.os": "others"}. Proposed change =============== We would like to add a new scheduler filter 'AggregateDefaultHostGroupFilter'. This new scheduler filter should be placed ahead of the existing filter 'AggregateImagePropertiesIsolation' like below: enabled_filters=RetryFilter,....,AggregateDefaultHostGroupFilter, AggregateImagePropertiesIsolation,.... Operator can add special image properties to the images created by them with prefix which can be configured by nova config options 'aggregate_image_properties_isolation_namespace' and 'aggregate_image_properties_isolation_separator'. For example; if 'aggregate_image_properties_isolation_namespace' is set to 'IMG' and 'aggregate_image_properties_isolation_separator' is set to '.' then operator can add special image properties as 'IMG.prop1', 'IMG.prop2' and so on. Operator will keep 'default host aggregate' pre-configured with default metadata upon which instances, created using user defined images which have no special image properties, shall be scheduled. Same metadata properties assigned to default host aggregate group are configurable using a new config option 'default_host_aggregate_group_metadata' in [scheduler] section of nova.conf. 'AggregateDefaultHostGroupFilter' will work as described below. 1) Image doesn't have special image properties(e.g. img.os:windows): In this case, the newly added filter 'AggregateDefaultHostGroupFilter' will check whether any special image property that starts with the prefix defined using the config options 'aggregate_image_properties_isolation_namespace' and 'aggregate_image_properties_isolation_separator'. If yes, it will immediately return True otherwise 'AggregateDefaultHostGroupFilter' filter will match host group aggregate metadata with metadata configured using the new nova config option 'default_host_aggregate_group_metadata'. If it matches, then it will return True so that specified instance can be scheduled on 'default host aggregate'. If it doesn't matches it will return False that means the hosts from 'default host aggregate' will not be selected by scheduler and scheduler will go to the next host aggregate. 2) Image has special image properties(e.g. img.os:windows): If image has special image properties that starts with the prefix as configured in nova config options 'aggregate_image_properties_isolation_namespace' and 'aggregate_image_properties_isolation_separator', then in this case, the 'AggregateDefaultHostGroupFilter' filter will always return True. The detail comparison of host aggregate metadata and image properties will be addressed by the 'AggregateImagePropertiesIsolation' filter. Note: In 'AggregateImagePropertiesIsolation' filter, if image doesn't have any specified property with prefix as configured in config option 'aggregate_image_properties_isolation_namespace', then this filter passes the host. There will be no issue when we configure both these filters one after another. If 'AggregateDefaultHostGroupFilter' passes the host, it is guaranteed that the filter 'AggregateImagePropertiesIsolation' will also pass that particular host. Alternatives ------------ An alternative solution would be to inject special image properties at the time of image creation in glance for image created by tenant users. This will be addressed in glance by BP: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/glance/+spec/inject-automatic-metadata, but it will solve the problem only for new deployments. Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- None Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- * Operator needs to set this newly added filter in 'scheduler_default_filters' * Operator needs to set the metadata for the "default host aggregate" to the newly added config option 'default_host_aggregate_group_metadata'. Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: Dinesh_Bhor (Dinesh Bhor <dinesh.bhor@nttdata.com>) Work Items ---------- * Add AggregateDefaultHostGroupFilter scheduler filter. * Add necessary documentation for the newly added filter. Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= * Unit tests can validate the expected behavior. Documentation Impact ==================== We need to add documentation for `AggregateDefaultHostGroupFilter` scheduler filter. References ========== * ML thread discussion on problem: http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-October/123172.html * https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/user/filter-scheduler.html * https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/admin/configuration/schedulers.html History ======= .. list-table:: Revisions :header-rows: 1 * - Release Name - Description * - Queens - Proposed

commit_message:
Bi-directional enforcement of traits

Add `SPECIAL_*` traits to resource providers and if these
special traits are not requested in flavor or images, then
those particular resource providers will not be returned
in the ``GET /allocation_candidates`` API call.

Change-Id: Ib3d170778b5bbd19738920514d434e8dc976a337
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/75/593475/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ============================================ Bi-directional enforcement of traits ============================================ https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/bi-directional-traits Add bi-directional enforcement of traits from resource provider side to ensure VMs booted using flavors or images doesn’t land on wrong resource providers. Problem description =================== If any flavor or image doesn't contain any ``required`` or ``forbidden`` traits, then all resource providers will be eligible to be returned in the ``GET /allocation_candidates`` API call depending on the availability of the requested resources. Some of the resource providers (compute host) could be special ones like `Licensed Windows Compute Host`, meaning any VM booted on this compute host will be considered as licensed Windows image and depending on the usage of VM, operator will charge it to the end-users. As an operator, I want to avoid booting images/volumes other than Windows OS on `Licensed Windows Compute Host`. Use Cases --------- 1. End-users can create new images without required/forbidden traits which could land VMs on `wrong compute hosts` if `inject metadata properties`_ is not enabled in the glance service. 2. End-users can boot images in ISO format with required/forbidden traits set on it and install it on secondary volume attached to the VM. During installation, nova doesn't copy glance image metadata properties to the volume. Later, users can make volume as bootable and use it to boot new VMs which could land on `Licensed Windows Compute Hosts`. Proposed change =============== We propose to add `SPECIAL_*` traits to the resource providers and if these special traits are not requested in flavor or images, then those particular resource providers will not be returned in the ``GET /allocation_candidates`` API call. If operators decides certain resource providers are special like `Licensed Windows Compute Hosts`, then they will assign `SPECIAL_*` traits to it and also assign these special traits to flavor and images in order to boot VM on those resource providers. Assignment of special traits to the resource providers are completely optional though. Let's take below example to demonstrate how it will work. .. code:: Below are the list of resource providers RP1: { traits: [HW_CPU_X86_BMI, STORAGE_DISK_SSD ] } RP2: { traits: [HW_CPU_X86_BMI, STORAGE_DISK_SSD ] } RP3: { traits: [SPECIAL_WINDOWS_LICENSE, HW_CPU_X86_BMI, STORAGE_DISK_SSD ] } RP4: { traits: [SPECIAL_WINDOWS_LICENSE, HW_CPU_X86_BMI, STORAGE_DISK_SSD ] } Request using various images and expected result IMG1: Expected_Result [RP1, RP2] { traits_required: [HW_CPU_X86_BMI, STORAGE_DISK_SSD] } IMG2: Expected_Result [RP3, RP4] { traits_required: [SPECIAL_WINDOWS_LICENSE, HW_CPU_X86_BMI, STORAGE_DISK_SSD] } IMG3: Expected_Result [RP3, RP4] { traits_required: [SPECIAL_WINDOWS_LICENSE, STORAGE_DISK_SSD] } IMG4: Expected_result [RP1, RP2] { traits_required: [] } As you can see in the above example, IMG1 and IMG4 will not return RP3 and RP4 because `SPECIAL_WINDOWS_LICENSE` trait is not assigned to it and in case of IMG2 and IMG3, only RP3 and RP4 will be returned. Need to change traits schema to allow assignment of `SPECIAL_*` traits to the resource providers. Note: Assignment of `SPECIAL_*` traits to the resource provider is completely optional. Alternatives ------------ The above use-case #1 can be resolved using `inject metadata properties`_ feature introduced in glance in Queens release. For use-case #2, forbidden traits set to images aren't copied after installation of ISO image on volume and this is a main problem. Similar to `inject metadata properties`_ feature in glance, we can think of injecting glance metadata in volume in `os-set_bootable` action API call. Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- To express certain resource providers are special, a new microversion will be added to allow ``PUT /traits/{name}`` API to accept ``SPECIAL_`` as a prefix. The `PUT /traits/{name}` API will return 400 error if the name doesn't start either with `CUSTOM_` or `SPECIAL_` as a prefix. Also, the same schema validation rules will be applied for special traits as that of custom traits. Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ There will be marginal impact on the performance to retrieve `SPECIAL_*` traits assigned to the selected resource providers from db, but it can be minimized by caching special traits in `set_traits` and `ensure_trait_sync` calls on the placement side. Other deployer impact --------------------- Depending on requirements, operator will need to set `SPECIAL_*` traits to resource providers. Assignment of `SPECIAL_*` traits to the resource providers is completely optional. Developer impact ---------------- None Upgrade impact -------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: shilpa.devharakar <shilpa.devharakar@nttdata.com> Work Items ---------- 1. Update `os-traits` to add SPECIAL_NAMESPACE. Add a new method is_special to check if the trait string represents a special trait. 2. Update Traits API to allow traits with prefix `SPECIAL_*` 3. Changes to ``GET /allocation_candidates`` API call to filter resource providers with `SPECIAL_*` traits 4. Add logic to cache resource providers with `SPECIAL_*` traits 5. Unit and functional tests 6. Update the placement-api-ref. Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= Gabbi tests should be sufficient to test this feature. Documentation Impact ==================== placement-api-ref doc updates should be sufficient. References ========== .. _`inject metadata properties`: https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/glance-specs/specs/queens/approved/glance/inject-automatic-metadata.html History ======= .. list-table:: Revisions :header-rows: 1 * - Release Name - Description * - Stein - Proposed

subject: remove basic distro packages from the repo server
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-10-18 01:50:28.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/horizon_install_source.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_horizon/commit/464112aaff06af925eee2ffe4f836ab3eb0c5b27', 'message': 'remove basic distro packages from the repo server

The build process was installing the general distro packages on the

commit_message:
remove basic distro packages from the repo server

The build process was installing the general distro packages on the
build target. While this works it installed extra packages on
environments resulting in unforseen issues. In this case the horizon
distro packages installed apache into the repo server which can, and
does, create a conflict with nginx.

Change-Id: I1fb6fa641085367ae3192ade2f289b6247c6c377
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_horizon refs/changes/75/611475/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-10-09 20:26:49.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/ibm/test_storwize_svc.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/ibm/storwize_svc/storwize_svc_common.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/7f241267d9ec8343fec1bbec4c0477cee9ce3fb4', 'message': 'Storwize: self assign the SCSI lun id for volume attaching

lun id.

This patch reverts the patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/360394/,

commit_message:
Storwize: self assign the SCSI lun id for volume attaching

Currently, the SCSI lun id is assigned by storage. But Storwize may
assigned the same SCSI lun id for different volumes on different i/o
groups. The wrong volume may be discovered with the same wwpn and same
lun id.

This patch reverts the patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/360394/,
Storwize volume driver calculates an unused SCSI lun id and sends the
SCSI lun id to storage.
To avoid the problem of patch 360394,  this patch retries 3 times to
map volume to host if there is CMMVC5879E error.

Change-Id: I3d3c61f913ff7ec8d35c8105cecc1a51accd21e7
Closes-Bug: 1757922
(cherry picked from commit c42aba603b394789da1a09822510ee3b428c1069)
(cherry picked from commit 542662d3a8e4e46af4d762732dd79d90f11c57dc)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/23/609123/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from retrying import retry ssh_cmd = ['svctask', 'mkvdiskhostmap', '-host', '"%s"' % host, '-scsi', lun, '"%s"' % vdisk] self.run_ssh_check_created(ssh_cmd) def _get_unused_lun_id(self, host_name): luns_used = [] result_lun = '-1' resp = self.ssh.lshostvdiskmap(host_name) for mapping_info in resp: luns_used.append(int(mapping_info['SCSI_id'])) luns_used.sort() result_lun = str(len(luns_used)) for index, n in enumerate(luns_used): if n > index: result_lun = str(index) break return result_lun @cinder_utils.trace if result_lun: LOG.debug('volume %(volume_name)s is already mapped to the host ' '%(host_name)s.', {'volume_name': volume_name, 'host_name': host_name}) return int(result_lun) def _retry_on_exception(e): if hasattr(e, 'msg') and 'CMMVC5879E' in e.msg: return True return False @retry(retry_on_exception=_retry_on_exception, stop_max_attempt_number=3, wait_random_min=1, wait_random_max=10) def make_vdisk_host_map(): try: result_lun = self._get_unused_lun_id(host_name) self.ssh.mkvdiskhostmap(host_name, volume_name, result_lun, multihostmap) return int(result_lun) except Exception as ex: if (not multihostmap and hasattr(ex, 'msg') and 'CMMVC6071E' in ex.msg): LOG.warning('storwize_svc_multihostmap_enabled is set ' 'to False, not allowing multi host mapping.') raise exception.VolumeDriverException( message=_('CMMVC6071E The VDisk-to-host mapping was ' 'not created because the VDisk is already ' 'mapped to a host.')) with excutils.save_and_reraise_exception(): LOG.error('Error mapping VDisk-to-host.') return make_vdisk_host_map()

 command: %(cmd)s
 ' 'lun: %(lun)s
 result_lun: %(result_lun)s') % {'cmd': ssh_cmd, 'lun': lun, 'result_lun': result_lun}) LOG.error(msg) raise exception.VolumeDriverException(message=msg) return result_lun except Exception as ex: if (not multihostmap and hasattr(ex, 'message') and 'CMMVC6071E' in ex.message): LOG.error('storwize_svc_multihostmap_enabled is set ' 'to False, not allowing multi host mapping.') raise exception.VolumeDriverException( message=_('CMMVC6071E The VDisk-to-host mapping was not ' 'created because the VDisk is already mapped ' 'to a host.
"')) with excutils.save_and_reraise_exception(): LOG.error('Error mapping VDisk-to-host') LOG.debug('Enter: map_vol_to_host: volume %(volume_name)s to ' 'host %(host_name)s.', {'volume_name': volume_name, 'host_name': host_name}) if result_lun is None: result_lun = self.ssh.mkvdiskhostmap(host_name, volume_name, None, multihostmap) LOG.debug('Leave: map_vol_to_host: LUN %(result_lun)s, volume ' '%(volume_name)s, host %(host_name)s.', {'result_lun': result_lun, 'volume_name': volume_name, 'host_name': host_name}) return int(result_lun)

commit_message:
Handling type's multiattach extra specs in API task flow

This patch fixs two issues related to multiattach extra specs:

1. Volume's multiattach attribute will always be False if it's
   created by a multiattach type while type is specified in source
   volume, snapshot, image metadata or config file, related patch [1].
2. 'MULTIATTACH_POLICY' will not be validated if multiattach flag is
   specified in the volume type that from source volume, snapshot,
   image metadata or config file [2].

[1]: a32e24ff3e2c3083b42dd3654355f8c101363147
[2]: ff30971d1f7b1f4febdef9358a999017bea2296d
Closes-Bug: #1770671

Conflicts:
    cinder/tests/unit/volume/flows/test_create_volume_flow.py
    cinder/volume/flows/api/create_volume.py

Most conflicts caused by the az-in-volumetype work done in
I4e6aa7af707bd063e7edf2b0bf28e3071ad5c67a and
Ibe937d5a97d685f5d9c3f8c03c5c384bb02a6942.

Change-Id: Ibec0656d9ead726ca12e62091fda74c04ec99eda
(cherry picked from commit 23f26555b3d4d1a089d09cd2335c39a73997c55e)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/91/593191/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 'raw_multiattach': multiattach,
deleted_lines: if (volume_type and self._is_multiattach(volume_type)) or multiattach: context.authorize(vol_policy.MULTIATTACH_POLICY) 'multiattach': multiattach, vref.multiattach = (self._is_multiattach(volume_type) or multiattach)

commit_message:
Be cleaner when unstacking a failed deployment

This prevents an error from "find" due to the
dir not existing.

Change-Id: I679f42ee88f1e8ae6d656195f5377a8b06f1cee9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack-plugin-nfs refs/changes/95/610095/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if [[ -d ${DATA_DIR}/cinder/mnt ]]; then find ${DATA_DIR}/cinder/mnt -mindepth 1 -maxdepth 1 -type d \ | sudo xargs umount -l fi

commit_message:
Strict isolation of group of hosts for images

The aim of this blueprint is to add a new
`AggregateImagePropertiesStrictIsolation` scheduler filter.

An operator wants to schedule instances having a specific
image property on a pre-defined group of hosts. In addition,
the operator would also like to prevent instances without
the special image property from being placed on this group
of hosts.

Implements: bp strict-isolation-of-group-of-hosts-for-image-and-flavor
Change-Id: If1f4a5eec06305daf3044ebac8a2e67dd45d0b85
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/12/381912/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ======================================================= strict_isolation_of_group_of_hosts_for_image_and_flavor ======================================================= https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/strict-isolation-of-group-of-hosts-for-image-and-flavor The aim of this blueprint is to improve `AggregateImagePropertiesIsolation` and `AggregateInstanceExtraSpecsFilter` scheduler filters. An operator wants to schedule instances for a specific image/flavor on a pre-defined group of hosts. In addition, he wants to strictly isolate this group of hosts for the image/flavor only and accept images/flavors without key scheduled to other hosts. Problem description =================== Currently with both filters we have the possibility to define images/flavors that will be scheduled on a specific aggregate following this matrix: +----------------+------------+----------+----------+ | props \\ aggr | key=foo | key=xxx | <empty> | +================+============+==========+==========+ | key=foo | True | False | True | +----------------+------------+----------+----------+ | key=bar | False | False | True | +----------------+------------+----------+----------+ | <empty> | True | True | True | +----------------+------------+----------+----------+ *Table 1: rows are image/flavor properties, columns are aggregate metadata.* The problem is: * An image/flavor without key can still be scheduled in a tagged aggregate * The hosts outside aggregates or in a no-tagged aggregate can still accept a tagged image/flavor Use Cases --------- Users want to schedule instances for a specific image/flavor on a pre-defined group of hosts and strictly isolate this group of hosts for the image/flavor. Proposed change =============== We would like to add one new option to each filter to: * Make tagged aggregate refuse not-tagged images/flavors * Make not-tagged aggregate accept ONLY not-tagged images/flavors +----------------+------------+----------+----------+ | props \\ aggr | key=foo | key=xxx | <empty> | +================+============+==========+==========+ | key=foo | True | False | False | +----------------+------------+----------+----------+ | key=bar | False | False | False | +----------------+------------+----------+----------+ | <empty> | False | False | True | +----------------+------------+----------+----------+ *Table 2: rows are image/flavor properties, columns are aggregate metadata* We propose to add two global options: * `aggregate_image_filter_strict_isolation` in `AggregateImagePropertiesIsolation` filter * `aggregate_extra_specs_filter_strict_isolation` in `AggregateInstanceExtraSpecsFilter` filter which dictate strictness level of the isolation: * aggregate_image_filter_strict_isolation = False or aggregate_extra_specs_filter_strict_isolation = False: the filter functions as before (Tab. 1) * aggregate_image_filter_strict_isolation = True or aggregate_extra_specs_filter_strict_isolation = True: the filter functions as proposed decision (Tab. 2) *For backward compatibility these options will be set by default to False.* We also propose to add these options configurable in per-aggregate. *Note that these options are independent and can be used separately.* Alternatives ------------ * An alternative solution would be to create new filters that inherits from `AggregateImagePropertiesIsolation` and `AggregateInstanceExtraSpecsFilter` filters. * A more configurable solution could be to use two config options e.g. `allow_untagged_images_in_tagged_aggregate=True` and `allow_tagged_images_in_untagged_aggregate=True` but currently we cannot find any cases of using this alternative. Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- None Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- * Operator needs to update the scheduler's `nova.conf` to set the options `aggregate_image_filter_strict_isolation` and `aggregate_extra_specs_filter_strict_isolation`. :: aggregate_image_filter_strict_isolation=True aggregate_extra_specs_filter_strict_isolation=True * To configure per-aggregate Operator needs to set the metadata. :: nova aggregate-set-metadata aggrA aggregate_image_filter_strict_isolation=True aggregate_extra_specs_filter_strict_isolation=True *Note: For existing system, instances will be not re-scheduled. The operator always have the possibility to do migration.* *Note that these options are independent and can be used separately.* Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: pkholkin Work Items ---------- * Updating `AggregateImagePropertiesIsolation` and `AggregateInstanceExtraSpecsFilter` filters to accept the new global options. * Updating `AggregateImagePropertiesIsolation` and `AggregateInstanceExtraSpecsFilter` filters to accept per-aggregate configuration. Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= * Unit tests can validate the expected behavior. Documentation Impact ==================== We need to update the documentation about `AggregateImagePropertiesIsolation` and `AggregateInstanceExtraSpecsFilter` scheduler filters: 'http://docs.openstack.org/developer/nova/filter_scheduler.html' 'http://docs.openstack.org/mitaka/config-reference/compute/scheduler.html' References ========== * 'http://docs.openstack.org/developer/nova/filter_scheduler.html' * 'http://docs.openstack.org/mitaka/config-reference/compute/scheduler.html' * PoC for the spec 'https://review.openstack.org/#/c/370458/' * first spec only for images 'https://review.openstack.org/#/c/85399' * implementation for the first spec 'https://review.openstack.org/#/c/80940' History ======= .. list-table:: Revisions :header-rows: 1 * - Juno - Approved (only for images) * - Ocata - Introduced (both for images and flavors)
